commit_message:
Raise bad request early if image metadata is invalid

Image data is currently uploaded into the backend store even if it is a bad
request. This patch add value validation in the deserializer so we don't set bad
data. It also does a full validation of the image metadata to make sure
everything that is needed for an image upload is set correctly before the upload
can occur.

There were currently some relevant tests that had incorrect names causing them
to not run. These have been fixed and modified.

Fixes bug 1035982

Change-Id: I6f3ef83ba7b3de3cb885fad9737fef1a03d9222c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-08 20:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'remove incorrect mock assert_called in unit tests

fixes bug 1047569

The unit tests were calling a nonexistent assert_called() on the
mocks.  This patch fixes the problem by using the correct assert for
checking that the mocked method was invoked.

Note: This patch does not fix the error in test_call_driver() because a
separate bug fix revises the test.

Change-Id: Ie62e2e64f314f9ba34761e63cd5d0d6e44c5d094
'}]
commit_message:
remove incorrect mock assert_called in unit tests

fixes bug 1047569

The unit tests were calling a nonexistent assert_called() on the
mocks.  This patch fixes the problem by using the correct assert for
checking that the mocked method was invoked.

Note: This patch does not fix the error in test_call_driver() because a
separate bug fix revises the test.

Change-Id: Ie62e2e64f314f9ba34761e63cd5d0d6e44c5d094

commit_message:
Fix dhcp agent rpc exception handling

fixes bug 1046904

This patch adds exception handling to log rpc exceptions.  Previously,
the agent would terminate due to uncaught errors during initialization.

Change-Id: I4835c1616e2ccfc9c42c591e8c7446db50721d01

commit_message:
check subnet overlapping when adding interface to router

Fixes bug 1046061

Add logic in _check_for_dup_router_subnet to check subnets are not overlapped.
Add testcase test_router_add_interface_overlapped_cidr.

Change-Id: I71b6cce07273686cc5e4636ce640b7201ce00b32

Fix data passed to policy engine on update

properly updated with the request body before feeding it to the
policy engine

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-08-20 15:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

(6 inline comments)

The call that you're implementing doesn't have a clear definition, hence it was never implemented. Regardless, if this is going to merge, it needs some work and community consensus.

Are you returning:

A) Roles granted to a specific user regardless of tenant ('tenant-specific roles')

B) "Global roles": Roles granted to a user without a specified tenant

If A, I'm not sure the call makes sense without also returning the tenant_id the role was granted upon. If B, I don't understand the use case.'}, {'account_id': 2560, 'date': '2012-08-21 06:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Well, what I really means is A.

The result should include role info and tenant info(which the role is associated with).I should add tenant id to the result.

At first, I think the result should be something like:
{"result": [
    {"tenantId": "111", "tenantName": "demo", "roles": [
        {"id": "1",
         "name": "admin"}
    ]},
    {"tenantId": "222", "tenantName": "admin", "roles": [
        {"id": "1",
         "name": "admin"},
        {"id": "2",
         "name": "KeystoneAdmin"},
        {"id", "3",
         "name": "KeystoneServiceAdmin"}
    ]}
]}
It's more clearly.

However, 'GET /tenants/{tenant_id}/user/{user_id}/roles' returns :
{"roles": [
    {"id": "1",
     "name": "admin"},
    {"id": "2",
     "name": "demo"}
]}

I think they should be consistent,otherwise, keystone client will be confused.'}, {'account_id': 2560, 'date': '2012-08-21 09:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-21 09:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-merge/1723/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-docs/227/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-pep8/1742/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-python26/772/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-keystone-python27/770/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/8573/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-08-24 14:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The problem then is that the identity API v2.0 spec defines the call as a list of global roles: "Returns a list of global roles associated with a specific user (excludes tenant roles)." This implementation therefore directly and explicitly conflicts with both the spec and other existing implementations of the API.

Given that OpenStack doesn't use global roles, it doesn't make much sense to implement the call here, *especially* when resulting behavior conflicts with the spec.

I believe Identity API v3 addresses this issue by redefining the same call, except either a domain_id or tenant_id is included with each Role (very similar to what's implemented here).

For reference: https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/openstack-identity-api/src/docbkx/admin/identity-admin.wadl'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-23 21:20:30.000000000', 'message': 'Triage for BUG #1017606

Keystone v3 API is not landing in folsom.

Tenant is used as an attribute in every single authentication
call be it API or command line utility.  In addition to that
the only place in all of openstack where tenants are referred
to as projects is still Horizon.  I understand the intention
is to change that, but in folsom this will not happen.

All documentation existing refers to tenants.

Leaving users without a means of figuring out what their
Tenant ID is from Horizon is poor UX.

All I ask is we put the word Tenant in paranthesis next to
"Current Project" so that users will be able to figure out
what their tenant id is.

Change-Id: I37092bfa5c49161a7bf3b40903948a52a7f86650
'}]
commit_message:
Triage for BUG #1017606

Keystone v3 API is not landing in folsom.

Tenant is used as an attribute in every single authentication
call be it API or command line utility.  In addition to that
the only place in all of openstack where tenants are referred
to as projects is still Horizon.  I understand the intention
is to change that, but in folsom this will not happen.

All documentation existing refers to tenants.

Leaving users without a means of figuring out what their
Tenant ID is from Horizon is poor UX.

All I ask is we put the word Tenant in paranthesis next to
"Current Project" so that users will be able to figure out
what their tenant id is.

Change-Id: I37092bfa5c49161a7bf3b40903948a52a7f86650

[{'created': '2012-09-07 15:12:23.000000000', 'message': "Set virt_use_execmem boolean if SELinux is enabled.

If SELinux is enabled, this boolean is required to be able to launch VMs using qemu.
Set the boolean if we're switching the libvirt_type to 'qemu' and SELinux is enabled.

Change-Id: Ieead35aae94c9fa86df1f4829584f71c97dcbeb8
"}]
commit_message:
Set virt_use_execmem boolean if SELinux is enabled.

If SELinux is enabled, this boolean is required to be able to launch VMs using qemu.
Set the boolean if we're switching the libvirt_type to 'qemu' and SELinux is enabled.

Change-Id: Ieead35aae94c9fa86df1f4829584f71c97dcbeb8

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-05 21:31:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add git_update_remote_branch to functions.

When $RECLONE=yes, and the branch specified for a project in stackrc is
a remote branch, the git_clone function would not recognize it as a
branch.  git_clone now attempts to recognize a remote branch and handle
it appropriately.

Change-Id: Ie23ff12eb5a7905088a9c2bb0ea2b02453ec0258
'}]
commit_message:
Add git_update_remote_branch to functions.

When $RECLONE=yes, and the branch specified for a project in stackrc is
a remote branch, the git_clone function would not recognize it as a
branch.  git_clone now attempts to recognize a remote branch and handle
it appropriately.

Change-Id: Ie23ff12eb5a7905088a9c2bb0ea2b02453ec0258

commit_message:
Configure Glance caching and cachemanagement

This configures and enables Glance's image caching layer.
* Set glance-api paste flavor to keystone+cachemanagement
* Copy glance-cache.conf into config dir
* Set appropriate values in glance-cache.conf

Change-Id: I230a984a08618c554727584538ed35d72f9bfbd5

commit_message:
Add initial images api v2.0 spec

Add a new markdown source folder with a single markdown file
that represents version 2.0 of the OpenStack Images API. There
is currently no way to 'build' this source.

Change-Id: I5f0b82d911230415eca2452def0fd2892b998d35

commit_message:
Execute attach_time query earlier in migration 98

MySQL was blowing up when sqlalchemy tried to execute the subqueries
in up/downgrade for migration 98. SQLite wasn't blowing up on this so
the tests were passing in Jenkins.

There are no test changes as it depends on the functional environment
in which you run the tests, not the tests themselves.

Fixes bug 1047665

Change-Id: I6eb3c8dd03495cdda2574efc9b5fc2b495fbcb37

This is failing because the file /etc/swift/swift.conf doesn't exist on the CI infrastructure. While updating this patch to account for that is trivial (and, in fact, I already have a local copy doing that), I'm not sure it's such a great idea. Swift will never start without having this file. swift.common.utils.validate_configuration() will ensure that the file exists and swift_hash_path_suffix is set. By allowing the CI infrastructure to work without this file, we end up testing under conditions that aren't allowed to happen (ever) in prod."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-06 05:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-06 05:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

commit_message:
swift constraints are now settable via config

Change previously hard-coded constants into config variables. This
allows deployers to tune their cluster more specifically based on
their needs. For example, a deployment that uses direct swift access
for public content may need to set a larger header value constraint to
allow for the full object name to be represented in the Content-
Disposition header (which browsers check to determine the name of a
downloaded object).

The new settings are set in the [swift-constraints] section of
/etc/swift/swift.conf. Comments were also added to this config file.

Cleaned up swift/common/constraints.py to pass pep8 1.3.3

Funtional tests now require constraints to be defined in /etc/test.conf or in
/etc/swift/swift.conf (in the case of running the functional tests against a
local swift cluster). To have any hope of tests passing, the defined
constraints must match the constraints on the tested cluster.

Removed a ton of "magic numbers" in both unit and functional tests.

Change-Id: Ie4588e052fd158314ddca6cd8fca9bc793311465

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-06 21:50:23.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: Make dom0 serialization consistent.

The dom0 plugin code had been using `pickle` for serializing input and
`json` for serializing output which was needlessly inconsistent. This
patch makes the code use `pickle`--chosen for its better handling of
`datetime` objects--for both sending and receiving data.

This patch also refactors the code so that neither the caller nor the
callee need to explicitly worry about serialization: the caller just
passes in args and kwargs, and the callee's function signature just
accepts the args and kwargs as usual.

Change-Id: I3abb42eeebd8d37d67e6c26fa7bcae66d876b3ee
Bonus: removes unecessary imports
"}, {'created': '2012-09-06 21:55:05.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: Make dom0 serialization consistent.

This patch also refactors the code so that neither the caller nor the
callee need to explicitly worry about serialization: the caller just
passes in args and kwargs, and the callee's function signature just
accepts the args and kwargs as usual.

Bonus: Removes unecessary imports

Change-Id: I3abb42eeebd8d37d67e6c26fa7bcae66d876b3ee

callee need to explicitly worry about serialization: the caller just
passes in args and kwargs, and the callee's function signature just
accepts the args and kwargs as usual.

Bonus: Removes unecessary imports

Change-Id: I3abb42eeebd8d37d67e6c26fa7bcae66d876b3ee
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Make dom0 serialization consistent.

The dom0 plugin code had been using `pickle` for serializing input and
`json` for serializing output which was needlessly inconsistent. This
patch makes the code use `pickle`--chosen for its better handling of
`datetime` objects--for both sending and receiving data.

This patch also refactors the code so that neither the caller nor the
callee need to explicitly worry about serialization: the caller just
passes in args and kwargs, and the callee's function signature just
accepts the args and kwargs as usual.

Bonus: Removes unecessary imports

Change-Id: I3abb42eeebd8d37d67e6c26fa7bcae66d876b3ee

Did you consider moving search_devs() to be a method on RingBuilder?  So you'd say builder.search_devs(search_value) instead of search_devs(builder, search_value).

The only potential advantage I see to the current way is the ability to pass in something not a RingBuilder object which has a "devs" property that's properly structured... but you could also argue that's a liability instead of an advantage.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-05 18:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In preparation for changing the builder serialization format to not use pickle, it'd be nice if the RingBuilder class had an object method for serialization used in bin/swift-ring-builder instead of pickle.dump().  The RingBuilder class method get_builder() serves well to encapsulate the builder file deserialization (woot!).

In other words, I'd like to see no reference to "pickle" in bin/swift-ring-builder and have that only live in swift.common.ring.builder.

Also, I'd prefer to see load/save naming convention for these paired methods (the factory class method which deserializes and the object method which serializes an existing RingBuilder object) versus get_builder().  Or perhaps load/dump to match convention in pickle, json, etc.?'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-09-05 19:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-05 19:49:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Breakout search_devs & add get_builder() for reuse

This moves search_devs into RingBuilder to make it accessible to other utils
that need to search the builder. Along the same lines this also adds a
load() call to get a RingBuilder instance when working with the builder files.

- This adds python-mock >= 0.7 as a dependency for unittests. On Ubuntu
  10.04 you'll have to pip install it, on 12.04 you can apt-get install
  it. Fedora 17+ should be able to yum install it.
- new pep8 compliance
- Fixed a small issue (undefined var) in swift-ring-builder when remove was
called but failed to find a match.

Change-Id: I2e02684235aa2f4e901a00858ae037091594c545

commit_message:
Refer to correct column names in migration 98

Database migration 98 was referring to local variables rather than
actual column names in update calls. This patch changes those
references to be the actual column names.

Fixes bug 1047633

Change-Id: I8ceead5be32f5f56b7d15c8bed23836b29fb382a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-07 17:32:45.000000000', 'message': "Stop lock decorator from leaving tempdirs in tests

In some versions of python 2.7, we must use the nonlocal keyword to
give an inline function access to a variable in the enclosing scope.
This leads to a tempdir not beaing cleaned up because a boolean in
the synchronized decorator doesn't get set properly. Since we are
still supporting python 2.6, this patch removes the method call
completely so we don't have to worry about locality.

The patch also moves acquiring the lock  inside the try, except to
make sure the tempdir is still cleaned even if there is some issue
with getting the lock.

Fixes bug 1047530

Change-Id: Ie3da18262e67de076b1e474c24edd2e4e5208646
"}]
commit_message:
Stop lock decorator from leaving tempdirs in tests

In some versions of python 2.7, we must use the nonlocal keyword to
give an inline function access to a variable in the enclosing scope.
This leads to a tempdir not beaing cleaned up because a boolean in
the synchronized decorator doesn't get set properly. Since we are
still supporting python 2.6, this patch removes the method call
completely so we don't have to worry about locality.

The patch also moves acquiring the lock  inside the try, except to
make sure the tempdir is still cleaned even if there is some issue
with getting the lock.

Fixes bug 1047530

Change-Id: Ie3da18262e67de076b1e474c24edd2e4e5208646

ConnectionRefused exception with appropriate information rather than as

commit_message:
Add ConnectionRefused exception.

When novaclient gets a Connection Refused it now presents that as a
ConnectionRefused exception with appropriate information rather than as
an HTTP exception.  Addresses bug 1047078.

vagrant@precise64:/opt/stack/python-novaclient$ nova image-list
ERROR: ConnectionRefused: '[Errno 111] Connection refused'

Change-Id: Iebf4d78a524004d5e79d2219b35f90fbd38ee690

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-04 21:04:27.000000000', 'message': 'Obj replicator cleans up files where part dirs should be.

If a partition directory was a file instead of a directory, the
object-replicator would attempt to listdir() it, raise an exception, and
try again next iteration.  This condition could arise after running
xfs_repair.

Now, collect_jobs() will reap any partition directories which are
actually files.  Fixes bug 1045954.

Change-Id: Id65d3eab2effd61c3f6b25250611c88c907b2a16
'}, {'created': '2012-09-04 22:23:20.000000000', 'message': 'Obj replicator cleans up files where part dirs should be.

If a partition directory was a file instead of a directory, the
object-replicator would attempt to listdir() it, raise an exception, and
try again next iteration.  This condition could arise after running
xfs_repair.

Now, collect_jobs() will reap any partition directories which are
actually files.  Fixes bug 1045954.

Change-Id: Id65d3eab2effd61c3f6b25250611c88c907b2a16
'}, {'created': '2012-09-04 22:23:20.000000000', 'message': 'Obj replicator cleans up files where part dirs should be.

commit_message:
Obj replicator cleans up files where part dirs should be.

If a partition directory was a file instead of a directory, the
object-replicator would attempt to listdir() it, raise an exception, and
try again next iteration.  This condition could arise after running
xfs_repair.

Now, collect_jobs() will reap any partition directories which are
actually files.  Fixes bug 1045954.

Change-Id: Id65d3eab2effd61c3f6b25250611c88c907b2a16

commit_message:
Call driver for attach/detach_volume

The volume driver may want to know which guest is going to be
attached to a volume. The manager now calls down into the driver
on attach_volume and detach_volume.

Fixes bug 1038109.

(cherry picked from cinder commit 17538890)

Change-Id: I084c2d09a1871fa158312f9ba479abb474da1d28

commit_message:
Use volume driver specific exceptions

Change generic use of exception.NovaException in the nova/volume directory
to specific exceptions. The exceptions used in this patch are:

 exception.VolumeBackendAPIException
 exception.InvalidInput
 exception.InvalidVolume
 exception.VolumeAtatched

Patch includes updates to the appropriate tests as well.

(cherry picked from cinder commit 3905a99)

Change-Id: I10407ff3f5babe64e88f445d3529269b7665ee16

This patch seems like it would break pagination. While getting a set of results without a marker would work just fine, trying to get results with a set marker would cause any instance after limit to be forgotten about.

If we had instances 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 in the db and we did a request with limit=1 then we would get [1] back, but if we did limit=1&marker=1 we would get [] when we should get [2]. This is because we would be getting a limited list of instances back before we paginate them and that list wouldn't contain instance '2', but only '1'.

Let me know if this isn't true or I have rambled into confusion"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-07-30 14:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a badly formatted commit message - you are not allowed to refer to the blueprint in the first line - it should be at the end.

commit_message:
Implement paginate query use marker in nova-api

1.add limit and marker param to db.instance_get_all_by_filters()
2.set the filter use marker
3.execute limit before sqlarchmy get_all()
4.add testcase 'test_db_api.test_instance_get_all_by_filters_paginate'
5.related testcase:
    test_get_servers_with_marker()
    test_get_servers_with_limit_and_marker()
  in nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py
    test_instance_get_all_by_filters_paginate()
  in nova/tests/test_db_api.py
6.add InvalidSortkey exception

Implement bp:efficient-limiting.

Change-Id: Iea3eeb7b51194b6017d624506aafc6469d7338e4

commit_message:
Add a tunable to control how many ARPs are sent.

This new flag, send_arp_for_ha_count, controls how many
ARPs are sent when binding a floating IP address to an
instance.  Also increased the default number to 3 from 1,
to make this more robust and guarantee other network
devices see them.

Fixes bug 1043796.

Change-Id: Ib9118fcc5334ef4a8c5d7a5e765364e26fea68da

[{'created': '2012-09-05 18:11:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix EC2 cinder volume creation as an admin user.

Updates the EC2 API _format_volume function so that it
only tries to add project_id and host to responses if those

using Cinder because volumes from it don't contain this

Fixes LP Bug #1046464.

Updates the EC2 API _format_volume function so that it
only tries to add project_id and host to responses if those
keys are present.  This resolves a KeyError that would occur when
using Cinder because volumes from it don't contain this

Fixes LP Bug #1046464.

Change-Id: I56b977cfd1ae482f2559a3f1fda8d1543d3ea227

commit_message:
Fix EC2 cinder volume creation as an admin user.

Updates the EC2 API _format_volume function so that it
only tries to add project_id and host to responses if those
keys are present.  This resolves a KeyError that would occur when
using Cinder because volumes from it don't contain this
information.

Fixes LP Bug #1046464.

Change-Id: I56b977cfd1ae482f2559a3f1fda8d1543d3ea227

commit_message:
Fix typo in tgtadm LOG.error() call

Fixes bug #1046875

Fix typo in LOG.error, it should be vol_id rather than volume_id.

(cherry picked from cinder commit d6a5d0f)

Change-Id: Id162c6f185a110b63e8f9f509f5cde75f3626cbf
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Return actual unicode instead of escape sequences in v2.

Ensured that when images are serialized to json unicode characters
are preserved as-is rather than being translated to ASCII escape
sequences.

Fixes bug 1045455

Change-Id: Ica6dc222bb8c8049cba7049720442d4c5bbb7d32

Child processes were returning to the main while loop
and spawning a next generation of processes. Instead
they should exit cleanly.

Fix for bug 1042823.

Change-Id: I8c0d150640c78487b43279a44d0d6d3ac3e386cc
'}]
commit_message:
Handle multi-process SIGHUP correctly

Child processes were returning to the main while loop
and spawning a next generation of processes. Instead
they should exit cleanly.

Fix for bug 1042823.

Change-Id: I8c0d150640c78487b43279a44d0d6d3ac3e386cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-06 19:46:55.000000000', 'message': 'avoid the buffer cache when copying volumes

The dd process when clearing volumes, was seen to starve
the system when writing to an iSCSI SAN connected over GigE.

So use O_DIRECT within the dd process so that the system
buffer cache is not impacted, which is generally the
best thing to do when streaming large amounts of data.

Also one could drop the I/O priority of the dd process
by prepending "ionice -c3". That would change the priority
from "normal" (best effort) to "idle", which means zeroing
will only proceed when there is no other I/O on the system.
It was thought best to leave scheduling decisions to the
system however, rather than specifying them explicitly.

Fixes bug: 937694
Change-Id: Ic842d7b83209c41d8ff05075990ed12e6f86283a
'}]
commit_message:
avoid the buffer cache when copying volumes

The dd process when clearing volumes, was seen to starve
the system when writing to an iSCSI SAN connected over GigE.

So use O_DIRECT within the dd process so that the system
buffer cache is not impacted, which is generally the
best thing to do when streaming large amounts of data.

Also one could drop the I/O priority of the dd process
by prepending "ionice -c3". That would change the priority
from "normal" (best effort) to "idle", which means zeroing
will only proceed when there is no other I/O on the system.
It was thought best to leave scheduling decisions to the
system however, rather than specifying them explicitly.

Fixes bug: 937694
Change-Id: Ic842d7b83209c41d8ff05075990ed12e6f86283a

commit_message:
Filter volumes and snapshots by query string

Fix query string search_opts filters in api.openstack.volume.volumes and
snapshots.  Fix get_all methods in volumes.api to adequately handle
parameter matching.

The current api does not properly apply query string filters by
display_name, status, or (in the case of snapshots) volume_id.  These
filters are needed both for the end user and operator to display logical
grouping of these resources.

Fixes: bug #1046353

Change-Id: Ia12ffe1bf8a27c8a78daa24c4b728b394932a2b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-07 05:52:56.000000000', 'message': "Update SolidFire driver to reflect IQN changes

 Prior to release the SolidFire device returned only
 a partial iqn string in it's api call.

 With the GA release, this was modified to return the entire
 iqn string, so just drop the prefix we were using in beta.

Change-Id: I7fa9d1ec6e2639149375a1115198eee90c527ef1
"}]
commit_message:
Update SolidFire driver to reflect IQN changes

 Prior to release the SolidFire device returned only
 a partial iqn string in it's api call.

 With the GA release, this was modified to return the entire
 iqn string, so just drop the prefix we were using in beta.

Change-Id: I7fa9d1ec6e2639149375a1115198eee90c527ef1

commit_message:
Asynchronously copy from external image source

Fixes bug 1008874, bug 1046433.

Avoid tieing up dispatch thread for large copy-from images,
instead initiate copy asynchronously.

The response status is not set to 202 Accepted as per standard
RESTful idiom, as a non-error response code change requires
an API version bump.

Instead, the incomplete nature of the image registration is
reflected in the image status.

Change-Id: I06692422490de0a7d93f63bbd0ffb9c6435a0d2b

[{'created': '2012-09-06 20:47:47.000000000', 'message': 'Allow cinder catalog match values to be configured

Depending on how a deployments keystone catalog is set up, the
default values passed in to the cinder client may be incorrect.
This adds a configuration option to specify exactly where to look
for the cinder endpoint in the service catalog.

Fixes bug 1047033

Change-Id: I93324b6930f384306311b0bbac375a9224283fbc
'}]
commit_message:
Allow cinder catalog match values to be configured

Depending on how a deployments keystone catalog is set up, the
default values passed in to the cinder client may be incorrect.
This adds a configuration option to specify exactly where to look
for the cinder endpoint in the service catalog.

Fixes bug 1047033

Change-Id: I93324b6930f384306311b0bbac375a9224283fbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-06 16:00:27.000000000', 'message': "support a configurable volume wiping method

Add a clear_volume() method that is called from delete_method().
This is only implemented at present for the base LVM driver.
This new clear_volume() method now supports these config vars:

  volume_clear = none, zero, shred
  volume_clear_size = size_in_MiB

'zero' is the default method and unchanged from previously.
'none' is used if security isn't a concern, or there is
  independent volume scrubbing.
'shred' is for more security conscious situations where
an overwrite count is required. Currently this defaults to 3 passes.

size_in_MiB can be used to limit the cleared area to the first
part of the volume, which can greatly speed up the operation,
and can be useful with encrypted volumes for example where
overwritting the encryption keys at the start is sufficient.

Fixes bug: 1022511
Change-Id: I7312678ff5d66156578501483a1b74e2a69e19a0
"}]
commit_message:
support a configurable volume wiping method

Add a clear_volume() method that is called from delete_method().
This is only implemented at present for the base LVM driver.
This new clear_volume() method now supports these config vars:

  volume_clear = none, zero, shred
  volume_clear_size = size_in_MiB

'zero' is the default method and unchanged from previously.
'none' is used if security isn't a concern, or there is
  independent volume scrubbing.
'shred' is for more security conscious situations where
an overwrite count is required. Currently this defaults to 3 passes.

size_in_MiB can be used to limit the cleared area to the first
part of the volume, which can greatly speed up the operation,
and can be useful with encrypted volumes for example where
overwritting the encryption keys at the start is sufficient.

Fixes bug: 1022511
Change-Id: I7312678ff5d66156578501483a1b74e2a69e19a0

commit_message:
Improve error message when flat network already exists

Fixes bug 1045601.

When attempting to create a flat network on a physical_network on
which a flat network is already allocated, the openvswitch and
linuxbridge plugins return a FlatNetworkInUse exception rather than a
VlanIdInUse exception referencing VLAN -1.

Change-Id: Id79e917e1376ebbb199efc3f14d9f378c6a04050

Rather than duplicating the test notifier module name, just use the
__name__ attribute on the module itself.

Also, where we were using stubout to set the notification_driver
flag, switch to using cfg's set_override() mechanism.

Change-Id: I46f705f71a4a220c235618491e06602fa4ea7a47
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify setting up test notifier

Rather than duplicating the test notifier module name, just use the
__name__ attribute on the module itself.

Also, where we were using stubout to set the notification_driver
flag, switch to using cfg's set_override() mechanism.

Change-Id: I46f705f71a4a220c235618491e06602fa4ea7a47

commit_message:
Fixes potential bugs found by pylint

Partial fixes bug #1043884

* remove _ec2_volume_get_query and _ec2_snapshot_get_query in
cinder.db.sqlalchemy.api, because they no longer be used in cinder.
* import openstack.commmon.utils.timeutils, because notify_usage_exists use it.

Change-Id: I3e989b940b6a99ac7751c940fa766aa13c61607b

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-02 13:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-merge/1138/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-selenium/46/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/5862/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-08-12 19:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-08-12 20:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I appreciate the contribution, but the direction of this patch just isn't quite the right solution.

To give some historical context, there has always been a "default tenant" field in keystone which unfortunately was never returned by the API when we need it (during the unscoped token authentication phase). The ideal solution is for that data to be returned (as it will in the v3 keystone API). We could perhaps even get that into the v2 keystone API now that it's clear that the v3 API won't happen in Folsom.

We've tried lots of workarounds for the lack of that default tenant. For one, we had a dropdown for choosing your tenant at one point. None of these solutions provided a good user experience. Remembering the last-used tenant became sort of a "next best option". Remembering the last-used "region" is an important additional component.

To bring it back to this patch, what we really want (if we don't have a default tenant) is for the last-used tenant to be stored in a cookie and used in the login code as a fallback when selecting the appropriate tenant instead of just iterating through the list of available tenants. That code no longer lives inside horizon, however, so I understand why this patch went the "log-in then redirect" route. However, that's really inefficient and (as Tihomir said) may conflict with other redirects.

Overall, I just can't see this approach working in a way that doesn't 1) cause conflicts or 2) confuse users.

If you would like to follow up on this patch I have two suggestions:

    1. Implement this as a pull request on django_openstack_auth and do it using a separate cookie that can be checked for in the case that a default tenant is not available during login.

    2. Add a second value to that cookie which is the last-used region (which, for anyone that uses regions) is actually far more important/obnoxious than the tenant.'}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:19:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Wouldn't it be better to associate the session id with the default tenant server side?"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:22:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Horizon's model stores nothing server-side so that distributed deployments don't need to worry about caching layers, etc.

As previously noted, I'm much more inclined to wait for keystone to fix the API and go from there."}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:23:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

yeah, i don't like the idea of putting an attribute used for authentication into a cookie."}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

rather a persistent attribute.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-07 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-07 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

This patch needs a DocImpact line added to the commit message - big doc impact here, docs needed.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-02 22:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Diagrams: http://comstud.com/cells.pdf'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-03 04:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is not the final commit message.  I just put this up quickly so people could view it here vs the branch on github.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-03 17:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, I've just started digging through this. A lot to absorb, but it looks very cool. Really nice work Chris!

I've sent you a pull request for some basic stuff - https://github.com/comstud/nova/pull/1 - hope that helps

Other things I noticed ...

First thing is that the you're using the 1.0 compute API - e.g. it is sending instance UUIDs rather than full instances. You'll eed to switch to the newer version since I think Russell may wind up adding 2.0 and removing support for 1.x.

On a similar note, the way you're sending instance_uuid as a positional argument is going to break in some cases I think. With the no-db-messaging work, the instance_uuid is not the first argument after context anymore. This works fine with the normal messaging stuff since that's all kwargs, but not with run_service_api_method(). It's probably best to switch run_service_api_method() to kwargs only.

The cells RPC API itself should be versioned. It would be really nice to be able to update child cells one at a time before updating the parent. So, a child needs to continue working with an old parent. The parent->child part is handled fairly easily, but to do the child->parent part the child needs to be aware when the parent only implements an older version of the API and use that. Maybe that would be something kludgy like a "parent_rpc_version" config option and you'd only update this to the newer version when the parent has been updated. Or maybe the parent version would just be in the cell_info stuff. Hmm, in fact we can only switch a child over to the new API when the topmost cell has been updated since intermediate cells would just pass the message up.

However, there's more trickiness. The run_service_api_method() exposes the RPC API of all services, so their version needs to be respected. And worse of all, we expose the nova.db.api and DB schema through call_dbapi_method(). Trying to think through how we might sort that out is making my head hurt, but I think it means that the cells RPC API would actually need to abstract away the version of the service APIs and the DB.

The get_vnc_console_info() bit looks wrong - get_vnc_connect_info() isn't a thing

The dependence the scheduler has on the manager is not ideal because all public methods on the manager would be part of the RPC API. I fixed that in my patches by prefixing the ones only used by the scheduler with underscore, but I suspect we could refactor the dependency.

Feel like I'm missing something obvious, but why don't cells have a UUID?

The code duplication between the filters and weighters loading would be good to resolve. And I guess there's duplication with the scheduler more generally. We have talked about putting some basic scheduling infrastructure in openstack-common since Cinder now also duplicates that. Maybe that's the path forward here too?

That's it for now!'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-03 18:06:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the feedback.  I'll absorb this and try to respond soon.  I've got a busy afternoon and then traveling back home tomorrow.

One thing to keep in mind:  90% of this code is 3 months old or more... so it definitely needs to be adapted for RPC versioning and so forth.  Shouldn't be much work.

It does actually function with the newer no-db-messaging commits... but I'm sure the generic call_service_api method stuff still needs to be cleaned up/adjusted somehow.  We're running trunk with this in a production cloud, which lends support to it actually working...  It's just not pretty... and there are a lot of limitations (security groups, host aggregates haven't been looked at).

Another thing:  I pass the instance_uuid down to child cells so that child cells can pull the instance from the DB... because the child cell is actually 'authoritative'.  In the child cell, we should be calling compute_api with the instance model and everything 'works like trunk' w/ the no-db-messaging changes, casting the full instance model to the compute managers.  So, I may not understand what you were saying regarding this.  I'll need to re-read your comment.

A few things that may help reviewers:

top level/API cell needs these options:

enable_cells=True
cell_name=api
compute_api_class=nova.compute.cells_api.ComputeCellsAPI  (going from memory)

Child cell:

enable_cells=True
cell_name=child001

(I think I have this info in my Folsom cells preso).  This means that only API has a special compute API class right now (to avoid being invasive).. and child cells use the normal compute API class."}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-14 22:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

quick review inline."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-07 02:59:41.000000000', 'message': "Handle missing 'provider_location' in rm_export.

Updates the remove_export function in the ISCSIDriver so that
it handles the case where provider_location isn't set on
a volume. This can occur if a volume is created but not exported.

This was a regression from a previous commit
(9785963c841aff5ea1c159da81f93c2bf62c70c6) which changed the way iscsi
targets are created/deleted.

Fixes LP Bug #1046484.

Change-Id: Ie762b092dd2a84fe4f3b72c46c03a97ae67c53b7
"}]
commit_message:
Handle missing 'provider_location' in rm_export.

Updates the remove_export function in the ISCSIDriver so that
it handles the case where provider_location isn't set on
a volume. This can occur if a volume is created but not exported.

This was a regression from a previous commit
(9785963c841aff5ea1c159da81f93c2bf62c70c6) which changed the way iscsi
targets are created/deleted.

Fixes LP Bug #1046484.

Change-Id: Ie762b092dd2a84fe4f3b72c46c03a97ae67c53b7

commit_message:
Generate a flavorid if needed at flavor creation

When creating a new flavor, it's now possible to omit flavorid. In this
case it will be automatically generated using utils.gen_uuid().
nova-manage and OS API updated accordingly.

Fixes: bug #1043410
Change-Id: Ibf9229599dac953177fbf1ffac5242ed716142db

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-04 02:13:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove dependencies for netaddr.

Updates cinder utils.py to remove the parse_server_string function.
This function is the only function in Cinder that required
python netaddr and it is unused so removing it should be safe.

Updates pip-requires to drop the netaddr dependency.

and are the only reason we need the netaddr dependency.

Updates pip-requires to drop the netaddr dependency.

commit_message:
Remove dependencies for netaddr.

Updates cinder utils.py to remove the parse_server_string and
is_valid_cidr functions. These functions aren't in use
and are the only reason we need the netaddr dependency.

Updates pip-requires to drop the netaddr dependency.

Also removes the unit tests for removed functions.
Change-Id: I521ae60b758324069fb1ffa1701b1f9deb780f65

vol_id rather than volume_id.
Fixes bug #1046875

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Specify the conf file when creating a volume.

Updates the tgt-admin command to actually use the config file
we create for the volume being created.

This fixes an issue introduced in
9785963c841aff5ea1c159da81f93c2bf62c70c6 which breaks iscsi
volume creation.

Fixes LP Bug #1046985.

Change-Id: I06e83c9ba351c2b4846b557a3abb170a51d506c0

commit_message:
Move api_samples to doc dir

The generated api_samples aren't used for the tests, they're only
included in git so that they can be synced into the docs. Move them
to the doc/ dir to make that more clear since I keep forgetting.

Change-Id: I0851ac0ee234dc1e8740666716733e05f856ddec

commit_message:
Rename heat-api to heat-api-cfn

The previous heat-api is, in fact, a CloudFormation-compatible API. Rename
it to heat-api-cfn, analogous to how the EC2 API in Nova is named
nova-api-ec2.

Change-Id: I9759f10cee6a60cdc9cb917966eb9fb95a618f85
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix and cleanup compute node stat tracking

Fix an issue where compute node stats are not reported correctly
if the instance's state was modified from outside of the compute
host. (e.g. nova-api server changing task_state prior to invoking
a rebuild_instance on the compute manager)

Also did some general cleanup on the stats code.

bug 1046591

Change-Id: I5d9fc78f22df6854777c5957cbc69c8dd5ec10d3

(4 inline comments)

Definitely a useful addition.  Some concerns inline.

A related issue - there may be a way to atomically remove items from lists in memcache (for both the list of user tokens and the list of revoked tokens) using a trick with prepend, as described here:  http://code.google.com/p/memcached/wiki/NewProgrammingTricks#Managing_lists_with_append_/_prepend

Do you you think this is worth implementing, either as part of this change or a separate one?"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-06 17:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add missing argument to novncproxy websockify call

Current websockify constructor in nova-novncproxy requires
target_path to be explicitely set. This commit adds the missing
parameter. Fixes bug 1031998.

Change-Id: I05e346b5df5bc1501b55ff606fc4cefdda889d60

[{'created': '2012-09-06 01:46:10.000000000', 'message': 'use less system resources when clearing volumes

The dd process clearing the volumes was seen to starve
the system when writing to an iSCSI SAN connected over GigE.

So use O_DIRECT within the dd process so that the system
buffer cache is not impacted.

Also one could drop the I/O priority of the dd process
by prepending "ionice -c3". That would change the priority
from "normal" (best effort) to "idle", which means zeroing
will only proceed when there is no other I/O on the system.
It was thought best to leave scheduling decisions to the
system however, rather than specifying them explicitly.

Fixes bug: 937694

commit_message:
avoid the buffer cache when copying volumes

The dd process when clearing volumes, was seen to starve
the system when writing to an iSCSI SAN connected over GigE.

So use O_DIRECT within the dd process so that the system
buffer cache is not impacted, which is generally the
best thing to do when streaming large amounts of data.

Also one could drop the I/O priority of the dd process
by prepending "ionice -c3". That would change the priority
from "normal" (best effort) to "idle", which means zeroing
will only proceed when there is no other I/O on the system.
It was thought best to leave scheduling decisions to the
system however, rather than specifying them explicitly.

Fixes bug: 937694
Change-Id: Ic842d7b83209c41d8ff05075990ed12e6f86283a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-27 15:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add admin actions extension

The optional os-admin-actions extension adds new wsgi_actions to the
volumes/action resource and a new snapshots/action endpoint.

With this extension both controllers will support an os-reset_status
action to force a database update of a volume or snapshot that is stuck
in a failed/incorrect status.  The os-reset_status action works
similarly to the compute api's os-reset_state action for instances.

The os-force_delete action behaves similarly to the "cinder-manage
volume delete" command and allows operators/admins to retry the delete
operation after it has gone into an error_deleting status with an admin
api call.

The os-admin-actions extension is enabled by default, but limited to the
admin api by the default policy.json rules.  Individual admin actions
can be disabled with policy rules as well.

Example of os-reset_status action on a volume:

curl http://localhost:8776/v1/${PROJECT_ID}/volumes/${VOLUME_ID}/action \
    -H 'x-auth-token: ${ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'content-type: application/json' \
    -d '{"os-reset_status": {"status": "error"}}'

The new admin only api can assist deployers who encounter bugs or
operational issues that result in failed actions.

It can also be used by future storage backends to support async callback
style status updates from long running actions or operations which have
encountered an error will be retried.

Also updates the api.openstack.wsgi.ControllerMetaclass to support
sub-classing wsgi.Controllers that define wsgi_actions.

Partial fix for bug #1039706

Change-Id: I29f4b892a99108b6c24eebc3eb58033a9e01e679

The optional os-admin-actions extension adds new wsgi_actions to the
volumes/action resource and a new snapshots/action endpoint.

With this extension both controllers will support an os-reset_status
action to force a database update of a volume or snapshot that is stuck
in a failed/incorrect status.  The os-reset_status action works
similarly to the compute api's os-reset_state action for instances.

The os-force_delete action behaves similarly to the "cinder-manage
volume delete" command and allows operators/admins to retry the delete
operation after it has gone into an error_deleting status with an admin
api call.

The os-admin-actions extension is enabled by default, but limited to the
admin api by the default policy.json rules.  Individual admin actions
can be disabled with policy rules as well.

Example of os-reset_status action on a volume:

curl http://localhost:8776/v1/${PROJECT_ID}/volumes/${VOLUME_ID}/action \
    -H 'x-auth-token: ${ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'content-type: application/json' \
    -d '{"os-reset_status": {"status": "error"}}'

The new admin only api can assist deployers who encounter bugs or
operational issues that result in failed actions.

It can also be used by future storage backends to support async callback
style status updates from long running actions or operations which have
encountered an error will be retried.

Also updates the api.openstack.wsgi.ControllerMetaclass to support
sub-classing wsgi.Controllers that define wsgi_actions.

Partial fix for bug #1039706

Change-Id: I29f4b892a99108b6c24eebc3eb58033a9e01e679

commit_message:
Add admin actions extension

The optional os-admin-actions extension adds new wsgi_actions to the
volumes/action resource and a new snapshots/action endpoint.

With this extension both controllers will support an os-reset_status
action to force a database update of a volume or snapshot that is stuck
in a failed/incorrect status.  The os-reset_status action works
similarly to the compute api's os-reset_state action for instances.

The os-force_delete action behaves similarly to the "cinder-manage
volume delete" command and allows operators/admins to retry the delete
operation after it has gone into an error_deleting status with an admin
api call.

The os-admin-actions extension is enabled by default, but limited to the
admin api by the default policy.json rules.  Individual admin actions
can be disabled with policy rules as well.

Example of os-reset_status action on a volume:

curl http://localhost:8776/v1/${PROJECT_ID}/volumes/${VOLUME_ID}/action \
    -H 'x-auth-token: ${ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'content-type: application/json' \
    -d '{"os-reset_status": {"status": "error"}}'

The new admin only api can assist deployers who encounter bugs or
operational issues that result in failed actions.

It can also be used by future storage backends to support async callback
style status updates from long running actions or operations which have
encountered an error will be retried.

Also updates the api.openstack.wsgi.ControllerMetaclass to support
sub-classing wsgi.Controllers that define wsgi_actions.

Partial fix for bug #1039706

Change-Id: I29f4b892a99108b6c24eebc3eb58033a9e01e679

commit_message:
Lower webob dep from v1.2.0 to v1.0.8

All other OpenStack projects expect webob v1.0.8 yet Quantum expects
v1.2.0. This discrepancy causes problems for certain projects that
can't actually support v1.2.0 yet. This patch aligns the required
version with that which the other OpenStack projects expect.

Change-Id: I21b4c6c79a0382f241131f22edbeba22388a688d

Chmouel, someone (redbo?) actually complained about too many PEP8 fixes in a single patch set, so I'm confused about a complaint about too few.

And I hesitate to speak for gholt, but based on his comment above, he was concerned about the version of PEP8 used to test compliance.  A later patch set addresses this--in my testing, a recent version of PEP8 passed."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-09-05 21:59:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ah, yeah, I was on both those references. :)

1) I like smaller commits so folks will actually review them.

2) But, if a file is being updated, it should be updated completely.

So I'm for short file lists but each file fully updated.

This update meets my criteria. :) The suggested updates I'm good with too."}, {'account_id': 5311, 'date': '2012-09-06 06:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-06 06:49:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Ensure token refresh. Fixes bug 1044316.

FAIL of test
  Request to list user's roles without a valid token should fail
used to be causing ERROR of
  Remove a role assigned to a user on a tenant

Solved by ensuring that this FAIL has no side-effects.

Change-Id: Ide5849f70aab26e2af2a52ed83371da9c51bf5d7

commit_message:
Sync some misc changes from openstack-common

Syncs the following changes from stable/folsom:

 769ec65 Don't trap then re-raise ImportError.
 202b8b7 Fix spelling typos
 01b4f31 Support for marshalling datetime while preserving microseconds.
 c11a0d4 Remove unused imports
 9e1bd9d Add missing convert_instances arg.
 2d6f847 Track to_primitive() depth after iteritems().
 8c74b37 Improve exception from importutils.import_class().
 1fb2361 add import_object_ns function

Change-Id: Id5885f4a00207cf70f15f195a154c45903111b8b

subject: Removes "XML is default" messaging in Requests/Responses
messages:
[{'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-09-04 22:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Anne, please let me know what you reckon about my comments.

messaging.

Patch set addresses reviewer comments and removes much of the section.

commit_message:
Sync latest cfg from openstack-common

Syncs the following changes from stable/folsom:

 4dc2043 cfg: clean up None value handling
 513bd3a Allow set_default and set_override to use None
 0a36c92 Tilde expansion for --config-file and --config-dir
 038d597 Add import_opt() method to ConfigOpts
 90da88c Modifies _is_opt_registered fcn to check for duplicate opts
 3af0786 cfg: Fix typo in documentation
 9f93872 Update common code to support pep 1.3. bug 1014216
 fb0f00e Use 'is not None' instead of '!= None'
 d1ec5ce Add support to include config aliases

Also, exclude keystone/openstack/common from pep8 checks because
it is pep8-checked in openstack-common anyway and all pep8 fixes
would need to go into openstack-common first.

Change-Id: Ie6354251942648c16c2be270af2b95f3f45e27ed

seems too broad and we don't want to waste more time on this until
the problem is fixed: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1046870

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-29 00:01:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix creation of iscsi targets

Previously when creating iscsi volumes, we were using

tgt-admin -e -c <config file> --update volume-id

Unfortunately the side affect of this is that tgt-admin
removed other volumes that wasnt connected to an iscsi
connector. Which is obvlously not what we want.

In order to fix this we create the targets.conf for the
volume but we call tgt-admin --update icssi qualified name.
We also set the tid in the configuration file now as well.

Fixes LP: #1038062

Change-Id: I23719390fbfaea5b55389a5c8ebaa8966cc283a8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-08-31 18:58:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix creation of iscsi targets

In order to fix this we create the targets.conf for the

We also set the tid in the configuration file now as well.

commit_message:
Fix creation of iscsi targets

Previously when creating iscsi volumes, we were using

tgt-admin -e -c <config file> --update volume-id

Unfortunately the side affect of this is that tgt-admin
removed other volumes that wasnt connected to an iscsi
connector. Which is obvlously not what we want.

In order to fix this we create the targets.conf for the
volume but we call tgt-admin --update icssi qualified name.
We also set the tid in the configuration file now as well.

Fixes LP: #1038062

Change-Id: I23719390fbfaea5b55389a5c8ebaa8966cc283a8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

what about xen? Does it not support hasManagedSave either?'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-05 09:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rather than enumerating all virt types (with ongoing maint burden), and given the fact that we just fall back to using
undefine(), I'd be inclined to use the "ask for forgiveness" python style like:

    flags = libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_MANAGED_SAVE
    while True:
        try:
            virt_dom.undefineFlags(flags)
        except libvirt.libvirtError as e:
            error_code = ex.get_error_code()
            if flags && error_code == libvirt.VIR_ERR_INVALID_ARG:
                # Retry without MANAGED_SAVE which is
                # not supported with LXC for example
                flags = 0
                continue
            raise
        break'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2012-09-05 13:19:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Vish
I doesn't look like xen has managedSaved instances according to http://libvirt.org/hvsupport.html (that is as far as my investigations went)

@pbrady
I agree with the idea of removing the list, but I'd like to remove the while loop (mainly to simplify the logic a bit), something like
            try:
                virt_dom.undefineFlags(
                    libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_MANAGED_SAVE)
                except libvirt.libvirtError as e:
                    LOG.debug(_("Error from libvirt during undefineFlags."
                        " Retrying with undefine"), instance=instance)
                    virt_dom.undefine()
            except libvirt.libvirtError as e:
                errcode = e.get_error_code()
                LOG.error(_("Error from libvirt during undefine. "
                              "Code=%(errcode)s Error=%(e)s") %
                            locals(), instance=instance)
                raise


this results in undefine being called regardless of the error code, for example if undefineFlags isn't implemented and if the flag libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_MANAGED_SAVE isn't supported,
would this be ok with you? If not I'll just use the loop.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-09-05 15:15:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Derek, yep nested exceptions are fine here if you prefer,
as we don't need the first exception when it's overwritten by the second. cheers."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:59:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Fixes bug #1044090

hasManagedSaveImage is not implmented in the LXC libvirt driver, resulting
in the following error when a vm is deleted "Error from libvirt during saved
instance removal. Code=3 Error=this function is not supported by the
connection driver: virDomainHasManagedSaveImage"

This commit replaces the use of hasManagedSaveImage, managedSaveRemove and

Change-Id: Ib8d451aeff7767f835c3c1aab99ee4ab5e299852
'}, {'created': '2012-09-04 11:12:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing call to hasManagedSaveImage

Fixes bug #1044090

hasManagedSaveImage is not implmented in the LXC libvirt driver, resulting
in the following error when a vm is deleted "Error from libvirt during saved
instance removal. Code=3 Error=this function is not supported by the
connection driver: virDomainHasManagedSaveImage"

This commit replaces the use of hasManagedSaveImage, managedSaveRemove and
undefine with undefineFlags (for kvm and qemu) which does the work of
all 3 calls and is implemented in versions of libvirt > 0.9.4.
We also revert back to calling undefine if undefineFlags raises an error or
if the libvirt type is not one of kvm and qemu.

This commit replaces the use of hasManagedSaveImage, managedSaveRemove and

Change-Id: Ib8d451aeff7767f835c3c1aab99ee4ab5e299852

commit_message:
Fixing call to hasManagedSaveImage

Fixes bug #1044090

hasManagedSaveImage is not implmented in the LXC libvirt driver, resulting
in the following error when a vm is deleted "Error from libvirt during saved
instance removal. Code=3 Error=this function is not supported by the
connection driver: virDomainHasManagedSaveImage"

This commit replaces the use of hasManagedSaveImage, managedSaveRemove and
undefine with undefineFlags which does the work of all 3 calls and is
implemented in versions of libvirt > 0.9.4. We also revert back to calling
undefine if undefineFlags raises an error.

Change-Id: Ib8d451aeff7767f835c3c1aab99ee4ab5e299852

commit_message:
Get the extension alias to compose the path to save the api samples

Use extension alias instead of the whole module path to compose the directory
where the api-samples will be saved.

Change-Id: I7a1ae1deab4aa67643d960555fe6dbdcbc4e3c45

[{'created': '2012-09-06 15:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'More EBS fixes.

Single instance with EBS apparently needs an httpd restart in order to
keep talking to mysql after we change the partition.  Also change other
EBS templates to use vdc.

Change-Id: I180cca2166a0210d5d8dd3e0aea111ea625b865a
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
More EBS fixes.

Single instance with EBS apparently needs an httpd restart in order to
keep talking to mysql after we change the partition.  Also change other
EBS templates to use vdc.

Change-Id: I180cca2166a0210d5d8dd3e0aea111ea625b865a
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-05 23:39:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extraneous whitespace in config files

One can not simply remove the hash mark in front of a commented-out
config option if there is a space following it. This patch removes
that extraneous whitespace.

Change-Id: Id084eef34a9e894de3f67b2919d55879cd9a715e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extraneous whitespace in config files

One can not simply remove the hash mark in front of a commented-out
config option if there is a space following it. This patch removes
that extraneous whitespace.

Change-Id: Id084eef34a9e894de3f67b2919d55879cd9a715e

ephemeral disk (fix from imain)

commit_message:
heat templates : EBS templates, attach volume to vdc

Fix Single_Instance_With_EBS templates, need the EBS
disk to attach to vdc not vdb which is used for the
ephemeral disk (fix from imain)

Fixes #185

Change-Id: I47d1b640d25c0f53dd4535e4bd73846d01f4fc86
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allocation pool creation should check if gateway is in subnet

Fixes bug 1046192

If the configured gateway is not in the subnet then it should not be
used for the allocation pool creation.

Change-Id: Ifba766a13d860b58d21034db278c6b24d4c126e7

Hi Yong,

This just adds another parameter "router:external" to a network.  So you can do things like:

quantum net-create net1 --router:external=True

or 

quantum net-list -- --router:external=True

I've tested both of those and it seemed to work without any additional changes to quantumclient.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-06 12:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Salvatore, it looks like this branch is back to being the original code I submitted, with the policy stuff moved to another branch?  If so, you can probably be a reviewer on this.  

Also, I split out the issue of DHCP always being disabled on external networks to a separate bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1046121'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-06 12:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

[{'created': '2012-09-06 12:17:59.000000000', 'message': "Make sure floating IPs  + gateways must be on external nets

bug #1042030

- adds admin-writable, world-readable router:external attribute to
the network object if L3 extension is loaded.
- prevents floating ips from being created unless network is external
- shortens L3 extensions alias from 'os-quantum-router' to 'router' to
make attribute extensions more readable.

WIP:
- Need to add policy logic so non-admin users can always see external
networks without requiring that these networks are shared (since VMs can
always create ports on shared networks, but provider may want to have
externals networks that VMs cannot directly plug into.

Random clean-up:
- prevent delete_network in plugins from implying it returns something
- modify extensions.py so that exceptions during calls to
get_extended_resources() will actually be logged if unexpected.
- unset executable bit on test_iptables_manager.py to make sure tox
actually runs it.

commit_message:
Make sure floating IPs  + gateways must be on external nets

bug #1042030

- adds admin-writable, world-readable router:external attribute to
the network object if L3 extension is loaded.
- prevents floating ips from being created unless network is external
- shortens L3 extensions alias from 'os-quantum-router' to 'router' to
make attribute extensions more readable.

WIP:
- Need to add policy logic so non-admin users can always see external
networks without requiring that these networks are shared (since VMs can
always create ports on shared networks, but provider may want to have
externals networks that VMs cannot directly plug into.

Random clean-up:
- prevent delete_network in plugins from implying it returns something
- modify extensions.py so that exceptions during calls to
get_extended_resources() will actually be logged if unexpected.
- unset executable bit on test_iptables_manager.py to make sure tox
actually runs it.

Change-Id: I5bbf063927b93458da7cb467d9ad5c92ebabbbf7

the new ARN format

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use lvs instead of os.listdir in _cleanup_lvm

Compute user may not have permission to list /dev/<VolGroup>
directory. This results in error during instance cleanup and not
deleted lvm images, if libvirt driver use lvm images backend.
To prevent this, _cleanup_lvm use lvs command instead of os.listdir.

This fixes bug 1042710

Change-Id: I82ab4ca5ba3320f50c84e23839fcf6ed8f02be8c

commit_message:
Fix snapshots querying original image after being deleted

This re-works snapshots to use cached image data that's in
the instance_system_metadata table

Fixes bug 1039662
Fixes bug 1012814 for newly created instances

(WIP -- tests aren't addressed yet)

Change-Id: I47976e11c4571b1f1702ec7a9f8800224001c763

[{'created': '2012-08-28 21:35:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add version to the network rpc API.

This change adds a versioned rpcapi to network and changes existing code to use it.
Tests have also been added to confirm that the produced messages contain the expected
output.

As the existing client API adds very little to the rpcapi it will be trimmed and
cleaned up in a future change to reduce code duplication.

Change-Id: I5ed78a81a7b5fe273c72711ee4d20fa91ca998a7
'}]
commit_message:
Add version to the network rpc API.

This change adds a versioned rpcapi to network and changes existing code to use it.
Tests have also been added to confirm that the produced messages contain the expected
output.

As the existing client API adds very little to the rpcapi it will be trimmed and
cleaned up in a future change to reduce code duplication.

Change-Id: I5ed78a81a7b5fe273c72711ee4d20fa91ca998a7

messages:

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/483/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/363/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-09 23:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Per discussion on #openstack-swift IRC chatroom this has further work to go.'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-10 13:06:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To summarize the discussion from last night:

1. The choice of what objects are compressed and how much is now going to be in the hands of the deployer by allowing them to map mime types to specific compression levels.

2. As different deployers may want to report either the on-disk size of an object or the actual size of the object this will now be a configurable item.

3. Tests are going to be added to confirm that compression is transparent and that things work as expected, but it will also confirm that the on-disk object has been compressed.

4. Documentation will be updated to reflect the above changes.

From my own head:

1. I am going to switch to using gzip compression as the time required for bzip2 is substantially more and doesn't provide as good of an experience for the client. Compression times should go down considerable while size will go up minimally to marginally, depending on level.

2. By doing the above I am now able to explore adding an option which provides the compressed gzip file to clients that are able to decompress it themselves, thereby reducing server-side resource consumption."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-10 15:40:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've always been concerned Range requests would be expensive for files compressed this way, since it has to decompress and throw away as much as you want to seek to."}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-10 15:43:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, unfortunately that is another trade off of compression like this. I don't really see a way to overcome it though."}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-10 22:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 22:51:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/488/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-docs/118/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-pep8/261/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/367/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/368/consoleFull : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-10 22:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-10 23:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 23:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/489/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-docs/119/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-pep8/262/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/368/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/369/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-08-23 18:06:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

I haven't had time to completely review this, so I'm leaving it as a +0 for now. but I'll go ahead and leave this comment to save the one inline comment (very minor nit to pick)"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See inline comment.

In addition, it'd be nice if the body of ObjectController.PUT() had less special-casing inside its body.  If you're going to check for enabled compression and wrap the file descriptor ("fd"), then why not make that wrapper work for both compressed and uncompressed cases?

That wrapper could have methods:

write(data) -- uses os.write() to ensure full writes to "fd", either compressed or uncompressed.  Returns bytes actually written to be used in fsync-every-N-MB check logic.  This would probably necessitate breaking up the currently-coupled semantics of "upload_size" which currently both means "byte-count-read-from-client" and "byte-count-written-to-fd".

close()  -- A no-op for the uncompressed case, but calls GzipFile.close() when compressing.

update_metadata(metadata) -- push responsibility for updating metadata with Content-Disk-Size, etc. into here, shortening the body of PUT().  Note that this wrapper would not need to call os.fstat(fd).st_size as that's already contained in metadata['Content-Length'] and os.fstat() needn't be called up to two additional times.

Anyway, I think that would result in an easier-to-read/comprehend PUT() method, encapsulating behavior change in the compressing-case inside a new object.'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-23 21:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

Working to incorporate feedback received.'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-25 23:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-25 23:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/5/check/gate-swift-merge/569 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/5/check/gate-swift-docs/199 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/5/check/gate-swift-pep8/342 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/5/check/gate-swift-python26/448 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/5/check/gate-swift-python27/449 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/9292 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-26 10:31:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'd like the compression method to be stored in the metadata.  Like just 'gz' stored under some key might help future proof things a bit.

Also, I'm not clear on why there's so many shenanigans around what Content-Length is set to.  I think it should probably just be the uncompressed object size, and some other key should be the on-disk size."}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-28 23:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The shenanigans around the Content-Length comes from input from a few people about accounting for the size taken up by an object. Some deployers may want to allow users to use the extra space that compression brings while others may not. The "largest" option is a combination of both to ensure that the situation of compression causing the size to increase does not provide a smaller size. I will freely admit it's a knob to allow deployers to tweak behavior as they want with no modifications required elsewhere.

As for your other comment about storing the compression type, agreed! I shall add it.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-29 01:44:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I get that, but I wouldn't want compression on the backend to change the client contract.  Plus some stuff in the code like lobjects expect content-length to mean content-length and will break."}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-29 17:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-29 17:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Work In Progress

Adding test to cover large objects and compression.'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-29 17:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The client contract is preserved - Content-Length there is *always* the uncompressed size, as that is the size of the object. Changing that would have broken the universe. Internally though what is stored is as I said, and anything that accesses the metadata will get that value. Additional metadata items also exist for on-disk and object size.

Re: Large objects - I have tested them and they still work perfectly fine. I will be adding a test to cover this though.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-29 17:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/6/check/gate-swift-merge/593 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/6/check/gate-swift-docs/222 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/6/check/gate-swift-pep8/365 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/6/check/gate-swift-python26/471 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/6/check/gate-swift-python27/472 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11110/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/9633 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-08-30 01:44:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If I configure the object server like this, the functional tests no longer work:

compress_stored_length = disk
compress = application/octet-stream=9,text/jibberish=9"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add server side object compression support

In certain deployments it may be useful to reduce storage consumption
in exchange for sacrificing computing resources when adding data to a
container and when retrieving it.

This compression feature allows different mime types to be mapped to
different gzip compression levels. If an object being PUT into a container
has a mime type that is mapped to a compression level the object will be
transparently compressed. When retrieving an object from a container that is
compressed it will be transparently decompressed.

This feature is not enabled by default and mime types must be specified by
the deployer for compression to occur.

blueprint object-compression

Change-Id: I50130e35b6044ec6c9d7e007b72d47ec451f988c

commit_message:
Implement the blueprint iSCSI-CHAP for cinder.

The user can provide the username and the password via the shell command when
attaching a volume with authentication to an instance.

Change-Id: Ib40485b5f20714b1b2bc15b98a46f1c5a3e5c5a7

commit_message:
Set TERMINATE_TIMEOUT to match other timeout values

The other default timeouts have been increased for exercises; this
should help with the false failures waiting for instances to terminate.

Change-Id: Ibe7ecbda160506a7b01c00dab8aa1ce3c895439f

commit_message:
Add a newline to user data injection.

If no newline is present at the end of the user-data section of the
template, the addition of the touch command will cause the last
line to break.

Change-Id: I15ba402f83f6fba03f7d0455a63a5dc03480973d
Signed-off-by: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implement duration calculation API

Add the API for calculating the duration for a series of
events from a given meter for a given resource.

Replace the old duration calculation in the storage engine API with
get_event_interval().

Change-Id: I54952e760fc5e108fa25d71b601b7ef2a4937e9e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Create tool for generating test meter data

This new command line tool creates meter events and writes
them directly to the database to make functional testing of
the API easier.

Change-Id: I23145da75dd6d671a36fa6cf8e5e613edabbb01e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
