I think we need to have a design discussion around this before we continue with code review.  I'd suggest creating a simple spec describing the current plan on linking it to the blueprint."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Hi,
I have a number of comments:
1. I am not exactly sure about the scheduler interface. I think that this should be something that is discussed in the community. I saw the initial mails but as of yet have not seen any responses.
2. If I understand correctly the feature that you are proposing will have the dhcp-agent running on a number of different hosts, with each host treating the local dhcp requests. I have a number of questions/comments here:
    i. what of one of the agents fails, for example an exception. Will the other be able to work as a backup?
    ii. Is there a flag that indicates that the agent should only treat local requests. If so then I think that you should address the way in which the files files with the port/ip/mac addresses are managed. Say, for example in the dnsmasq, you should only update the _output_hosts_file if and only if the guest is running on the host (maybe I am missing something here). The RPC broadcasts that are pending approval in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9591/ may be used to make use of the information. Maybe the host can be piggybacked on the messages to indicate if port should be updated locally.
Maybe it is also worthwhile about having a discussion in the community about the host entry on the port. 
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi,
One more note. Is this something that can be done per network (please look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10320/)
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Thank you for the comment.'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (5 inline comments)

Thank you for the comments.'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

aagggrrrr I'm sorry for the mess of quoted. I'm not familiar with gerrit yet."}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored

Confirmed the new spec.'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Hi, One more note. Is this something that can be done per network (please look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10320/)
Thanks for the note. I've quickly looked at them. The behavior that reducing dhcp processes looks similar.

But the purpose is different, I thought. They seems to only disable the dhcp per network. We would host the dhcp on appropriate host with scheduler for HA."}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> 1. I am not exactly sure about the scheduler interface. I think that this should be something that is discussed in the community. I saw the initial mails but as of yet have not seen any responses.

Unfortunately yes :( but it also looks like "no objection" :) sorry, its joke. Anyway.
As you see, current implementation of scheduler is a feature of the scheduler we would make.
Personally, I think such scheduling feature will also be needed for rpc, for example the nova.

> 2. If I understand correctly the feature that you are proposing will have the dhcp-agent running on a number of different hosts, with each host treating the local dhcp requests. I have a number of questions/comments here:
> i. what of one of the agents fails, for example an exception. Will the other be able to work as a backup?

Answers for each situation:

If an agent is dead or raising exception for a long time on an host, supervisor or a kind of such process management software should recover environment.
If a child dhcp process is dead, the agent who is parent of the child revives them. This is implemented by Mark.
If a child dhcp process doesn't communicate anything like a zombie, one or more dhcp processes can be on an host, or on a vlan by assigning different IP address in same subnet. This is the purpose of quantum dhcp HA. For this, wise scheduler is needed. This is why we introduce the scheduler.

> ii. Is there a flag that indicates that the agent should only treat local requests. If so then I think that you should address the way in which the files files with the port/ip/mac addresses are managed. Say, for example in the dnsmasq, you should only update the _output_hosts_file if and only if the guest is running on the host (maybe I am missing something here). The RPC broadcasts that are pending approval in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9591/ may be used to make use of the information. Maybe the host can be piggybacked on the messages to indicate if port should be updated locally.
Maybe it is also worthwhile about having a discussion in the community about the host entry on the port. 

What did you mean "the agent should only treat local requests"?
With the reviewing changes, the agent only treats a port is assigned or not, to the host which the agent is running on.
 
Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

hold on this until Grizzly'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Done. Only change the message.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Mark,Gary
1) It is original problem of Multi-host mode.
May be we can solve this by using nat something like metadata server.

(Note: the downside of this approach is that each DHCP instance consumes an IP, meaning it can reduce the number of available IPs on a subnet (i.e., it probably makes sense to double or triple the size of the subnet when using multi_host, assuming subnets are using "free" RFC 1918 space   https://blueprints.launchpad.net/quantum/+spec/quantum-multihost-dhcp).


2) Let's discuss this in mailing list. 
3) host attribute could be updated using nova notification driver.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Couple of issues:

1) I understand the HA needs for DHCP, but I am not sure this is the right approach.  Specifically, this approach consumes many additional ports for DHCP than are really needed to provide HA.  Worst case scenario: All of a tenant's VM running on different hosts would result in double the number of ports consumed on a network.  This is not a good utilization of resources even for HA.

2) Like garyk, I'd like to see more community discussion about the scheduler before proceeding.

3) I'm also unsure about the host entry on the port model. What process is responsible for updating this value when a VM migrates?"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

This patch forces multi host to always be enabled.  It should be a configurable option for service providers to enable/disable."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

I have two issues with this implementation:

1) The proposed designed leads to an awkward state where the agent thinks it is managing DHCP for a network when in fact the driver has declined to do so.   For nova style multi-host dhcp you want to effectively filter the network information.  You would be better off adding adding support in enable_dhcp_helper and in the port_create_end handler.

2) The style of the unit tests are not consistent with the rest of the test suite.  Skipping the class initialization and then directly assigning mocks at test time hinders actually testing the code to make sure the wrapper works."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-08-27 09:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have to agree with the point made in the bug that this would only be duplicating a standard system config variable.
We should be avoiding new config vars at all costs, and this one isn't needed IMHO"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-08-27 10:25:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

How do you see people setting that environment variable for something like nova-compute? Adding it to the init script?

(I'm not opposed to that route, just seeking clarification)."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-08-27 11:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You could set in an init script.

Or systemd has support for a http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Features/ServicesPrivateTmp

Or some systems like debian default to /tmp on tmpfs,
and so might want to config stuff like this at the global system level.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-27 23:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This complaint has come around so many times, and getting people to set global config variables for installs seems to be beyond most users, so alllowing them to do it via a config options seems much more user friendly.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-04 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Implement the blueprint iSCSI-CHAP for Cinder.

It allows the user to enter the username and the password to authenticate
the volume with the enabled credentials.

commit_message:
Require 'status' in simple db image_create

Since the sqlalchemy driver requires that 'status' be set in an
image_create call, this makes the simple driver follow suit.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

Change-Id: I0b6809e467fa8aecfefcd7017cd198ca0691a236

commit_message:
Always call stop_servers() after having started them in tests

Several functional tests were not stopping the servers.

Fix bug 1043416.

Change-Id: I362e116089e6baa3e8f9ab16be1d6c54dbf957da

commit_message:
Fix LP bug #1044462 cfg items need secret=True

Redact sensitive log information such as
sql_connection
metadata_encryption_key
admin_password
admin_user
admin_tenant
when cfg item summaries are printed in logs

Change-Id: I74cfeae4b8bdbd405fbc4baca763a62f4470b154

commit_message:
Add API samples to images api

Fixes issue with updated metata not being returned properly from
the api. Adds a small check to the samples baseclass to allow the
output to be generated even if the template file is empty.

Change-Id: Idcdd24d7e785026e50b9abf4762466fd55a8d42f

Add method to manage 'put' requests in api-sample tests

Include a _do_put() method into tests_api_samples to generate api-samples to
put requests.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-03 15:45:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hyperv driver spawn() signature

Fixes bug #1045392

commit 99fb9d2a changed the signature of the spawn() method but not
all drivers were updated for the change.

The injected_files and admin_password instance attributes were ignored
by the hyperv driver before, so we can just ignore them in spawn() now
that they are being passed as function arguments.

Change-Id: I129d21316488a18a4f062252ba5f788bc65c7c25
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hyperv driver spawn() signature

Fixes bug #1045392

commit 99fb9d2a changed the signature of the spawn() method but not
all drivers were updated for the change.

The injected_files and admin_password instance attributes were ignored
by the hyperv driver before, so we can just ignore them in spawn() now
that they are being passed as function arguments.

Change-Id: I129d21316488a18a4f062252ba5f788bc65c7c25

commit_message:
Fix vmwareapi driver spawn() signature

Fixes bug #1045393

commit 99fb9d2a changed the signature of the spawn() method but not
all drivers were updated for the change.

The injected_files and admin_password instance attributes were ignored
by the hyperv driver before, so we can just ignore them in spawn() now
that they are being passed as function arguments.

Change-Id: Ifc4279a05127dcc5c01388882c40570bf6de5ff2

commit_message:
Add full python path to test stubbing modules for libvirt

libvirt test modules were relatively addressed (import fakelibvirt etc.)
and this meant that running the test specifically
(./run_tests test_virt_drivers) would fail with missing imports.

Change-Id: I81f019bf635e10ca90f77f7a30b2e19065fee8f4

Limit simple db image_create to known image attrs

image attributes.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

commit_message:
Raise Duplicate on image_create with duplicate id

The simple db would allow a user to create new images using IDs
that belonged to existing images. This patch corrects that behavior
and adds a test.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

Change-Id: I42a036f81e61413e789d87100f58b45b8cc75d38

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

I'm really not a fan of exposing agent Id via the "logical" API, particularly as part of the main L3 extension.   There will be L3 extensions that don't even use an agent, so I don't think it makes sense to hard code that as part of the L3 API.  

Clearly the agent and the tenant API must share some identifier, but why not configure the agent with the specified router-id?  It seems reasonable to start the main quantum service, make an API to create a router, modify the L3 config, and spawn the L3 agent.  In fact, this is exactly what people will do who want to use the "one VM per quantum router" model.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ok, I'll update accordingly. I just think that it may be a bit cumbersome for someone who works like this. I guess that we will need to document accordingly. Configuring the agent ID or a list of ID's may give some flexibility to a user."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build successful

Build failed

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

I agree with the rationale behind this decision.
However, I was wondering how bad would it be to discriminate on the logical router name rather than its id.
This will allow us to launch the agent independently of whether the router has been yet created or not. The drawback is the fact that names are not unique. This corner case can be documented and we might decide to raise in the agent if two routers with the same name are found.

Adding this dependency on the agent startup is proving to be not so trivial in devstack, as we would now need to first configure routers and gateway and then start the agent. In particular network creation code for quantum and nova-network use case is ending up in two different parts of stack.sh and this might be confusing.
Also, people willing to deploy the l3 agent without devstack might not want to have this dependency. 

Let me know your opinion. Anyway, this is not going to be a blocker in approving this patch.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Approving after discussing with gary on IRC pro and cons of the two approaches.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I have not yet tested this, but design and code-wise it looks good.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi,
The router name sounds logical and I think that it is a better solution. I think that this is also relevant for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12309/ (the external_id is set in this case).
I think that we should tackle both in the same way to ensure consistency.
What do you think?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'message': 'L3: make use of namespaces by agent configurable

Fixes bug 1042104

The fix follows the patch that was done on the DHCP agent to enable
the user to configure the usage of namespaces. In the event that
namspaces are disabled the agent is limited to running only one
router. The agent needs to define the router_id that is supported.
The process in this case is:
1. create router
2. start agent with router id

Change-Id: I2a71dc009c5aea285ff9f903b3faa99b0c9f820f
'}, {'created': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'message': 'L3: make use of namespaces by agent configurable

Fixes bug 1042104

The fix follows the patch that was done on the DHCP agent to enable
the user to configure the usage of namespaces. In the event that
namspaces are disabled the agent is limited to running only one
router. The agent needs to define the router_id that is supported.
The process in this case is:
1. create router
2. start agent with router id

Change-Id: I2a71dc009c5aea285ff9f903b3faa99b0c9f820f
'}, {'created': '2012-09-04 00:07:27.000000000', 'message': "L3: make use of namespaces by agent configurable

Fixes bug 1042104

The fix follows the patch that was done on the DHCP agent to enable
the user to configure the usage of namespaces. In the event that
namspaces are disabled the agent is limited to running only one
router. In this case the router that can be run will be the router
that has a matching 'agent_id'. In this case the 'agent_id' should be
defined on the l3 agent (via configuration file) and on the router (via
the Quantum API).

Change-Id: I2a71dc009c5aea285ff9f903b3faa99b0c9f820f

Change-Id: I2a71dc009c5aea285ff9f903b3faa99b0c9f820f
'}]
commit_message:
L3: make use of namespaces by agent configurable

Fixes bug 1042104

The fix follows the patch that was done on the DHCP agent to enable
the user to configure the usage of namespaces. In the event that
namspaces are disabled the agent is limited to running only one
router. The agent needs to define the router_id that is supported.
The process in this case is:
1. create router
2. start agent with router id

Change-Id: I2a71dc009c5aea285ff9f903b3faa99b0c9f820f

This change looks good.

One related item that I had a question about.  It seems that in RPC mode, if there's an old port hanging around on the integration bridge that has a port-id not known to quantum, the code ignores it.  This means this port is still on its previous vlan, which may now have a totally different meaning.  It seems safer to set such ports to the dead vlan, as is done in the non-RPC code  (note: this comment is based on only superficial testing and code analysis, so it may be wrong)."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

Actually, I another change here needs to be made since if the port does not actually exist port.ofport will be -1 causing port_dead() to throw an exception.  The easy fix would be to add   if int(port.ofport) != -1: right before port_dead is called.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-09-04 00:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Ensure that port update set correct tag in OVS

Fixes bug 1044556.

This patch also ensures that the local vlan mapping is updated correctly.
This was problematic in the event that the OVS agent would start and a port
was in administrative state down.

Change-Id: I4e5145547e73a58fee3f08a129fda6bc0ec42b72

commit_message:
Expand image_create db test

Ensure the test that checks for default values when calling
image_create is expecting the right things. The simple db driver
needed some love to get it to pass the thicker test.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity

Change-Id: I80f0ee55ff5ec18e544b91bed218e8c6e3b06a84

commit_message:
Catch pruner exception when no images are cached

This handles a situation where the pruner would raise an exception when
the image_cache_max_size was set lower than the size of the last image.

Fixes bug 1039854

Change-Id: I4a6c164e9f821f1250314974f829f058fbd02863

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-27 21:29:28.000000000', 'message': 'Delete image from backend store on delete.

Fixes bug 1039897

Change-Id: I8a13b8c302b13ba219b1edcc128d02481ed7666e
'}, {'created': '2012-08-28 15:11:02.000000000', 'message': 'Delete image from backend store on delete.

Fixes bug 1039897

Change-Id: I8a13b8c302b13ba219b1edcc128d02481ed7666e
'}, {'created': '2012-08-30 14:52:45.000000000', 'message': "Delete image from backend store on delete.

Two things have been done for this patch, schedule_delete_from_backend has
been split into two functions: safe_delete_from_backend and
schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend. If the API is not configured for
depalyed delete safe_delete_from_backend is called, which immidiately
deletes the image from the backend store and status set to deleted.
Likewise, if the API is configured for delayed delete,
schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend will be called which writes out a new
file in the scrubber_datadir named with the image id and containing the
backend uri and delete time. The image's status is then set to pending_delete
and the scrubber will then delete the image at the appropriate time.
The other main change is pulling the status updates out of the backend delete
functions. In this case they are done in the API after each respective type
of delete. All other changes were around testing and dependancy injection,
specifically the ability to inject a fake StoreAPI.

Fixes bug 1039897

Change-Id: I8a13b8c302b13ba219b1edcc128d02481ed7666e
"}, {'created': '2012-09-03 20:07:06.000000000', 'message': "Delete image from backend store on delete.

Two things have been done for this patch, schedule_delete_from_backend has
been split into two functions: safe_delete_from_backend and
schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend. If the API is not configured for
depalyed delete safe_delete_from_backend is called, which immidiately
deletes the image from the backend store and status set to deleted.
Likewise, if the API is configured for delayed delete,
schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend will be called which writes out a new
file in the scrubber_datadir named with the image id and containing the
backend uri and delete time. The image's status is then set to pending_delete
and the scrubber will then delete the image at the appropriate time.
The other main change is pulling the status updates out of the backend delete
functions. In this case they are done in the API after each respective type
of delete. All other changes were around testing and dependancy injection,
specifically the ability to inject a fake StoreAPI.

Fixes bug 1039897

Change-Id: I8a13b8c302b13ba219b1edcc128d02481ed7666e
"}]
commit_message:
Delete image from backend store on delete.

Two things have been done for this patch, schedule_delete_from_backend has
been split into two functions: safe_delete_from_backend and
schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend. If the API is not configured for
depalyed delete safe_delete_from_backend is called, which immidiately
deletes the image from the backend store and status set to deleted.
Likewise, if the API is configured for delayed delete,
schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend will be called which writes out a new
file in the scrubber_datadir named with the image id and containing the
backend uri and delete time. The image's status is then set to pending_delete
and the scrubber will then delete the image at the appropriate time.
The other main change is pulling the status updates out of the backend delete
functions. In this case they are done in the API after each respective type
of delete. All other changes were around testing and dependancy injection,
specifically the ability to inject a fake StoreAPI.

Fixes bug 1039897

Change-Id: I8a13b8c302b13ba219b1edcc128d02481ed7666e

commit_message:
Use PATCH instead of PUT for v2 image modification

With the previous partial put syntax in the v2 api, it was not possible
to delete image properties. This patch provides a more expressive syntax
in the form of the HTTP PATCH verb. This implementation depends on the
`application/openstack-images-v2.0-json-patch` content-type which is
intended to be a compatible subset of application/json-patch.

Addresses bug 1039821.

Change-Id: I510ab397f9b8b5bd1deec0fb25855e305e7ec86e

commit_message:
Clean up comments in paste files

* Reduce comments in paste files to just what is necessary
* Add a 'cachemanage' pipeline to complete our set of paste
  deploy flavors in glance-api-paste.ini
* Add a sample [paste_deploy] section to both glance-api and
  glance-registry configs

Related to bp glance-folsom-docs-cleanup.

Change-Id: I0208b12f6861b48e52260b25802c47ebf6316b9a

commit_message:
Fix vmware WSDL configuration - SDK needed

fixes bug 1044414

As in the bug report, the instructions that say you only need
the WSDL are incorrect - the entire SDK is needed.

Updated example config to match.

commit_message:
Fixes spawn method signature for PowerVM driver.

ComputeDriver has now 2 new required arguments which are:
injected_files and admin_password. This patch adds the
arguments in the PowerVMDriver spawn signature.

Fixes bug 1040770

Change-Id: I0a45fa45c942f2d0381c5a7310d386ae655073fe

commit_message:
Fix support for eventlet 0.9.16

The changes in c7059ae54ef2712e7599a6de30a631d3a0bb6bd2 were not enough
to provide compatibility with 0.9.16 and 0.9.17.ith 0.9.16 and 0.9.17.

Change-Id: Id1ddc988443e162f1c835505b619b7b45e86578d
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Fixes sqlalchemy.api.compute_node_get_by_host

Use join('service') instead of options(joinedload('service')) to get
the right compute_node

Fixes bug 1044238

Change-Id: I082a46847e63a1e21083a625c3b07ec9be05412f

commit_message:
Implement L3 support in Metaplugin

Added flavor:route property for router
Rename flavor:id to flavor:network
Fixes bug 1038778

Change-Id: Ia358b4f03c1b96ade2d1b7323298b117b2cbe52a

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-31 02:12:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Really we need to figure out what to do with this binary. It really /belongs/ in common, but we don't have binaries there. This binary is needed to use ZeroMQ in quantum or ceilometer, for instance...

Maybe this should just have its own repository, pulling the rpc/cfg/etc bits from common?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Eric, I thought openstack-common was a library (not sure binaries are going to be allowed). In any case I suppose it would be nice if this lived in a generic location.

That said, for now (Folsom) we copy openstack-common and all its pieces into each project. With respect to this binary I think end users would like a config file to be able to control the config options we provide. And for now using nova.conf seems reasonable.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:19:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan, precisely why this binary is still in Nova. The issue remains that this binary is needed by other projects besides Nova, so something should be done about that. Not to say this patch shouldn't go through..."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Update nova-rpc-zmq-receiver to load nova.conf.

Updates the bin/nova-rpc-zmq-receiver so that it makes use of FLAGS,
calls parse_args, and loads the nova.conf config file like all
other nova- binaries.

Fixes LP Bug #1044153

Change-Id: I904e5d2ae491cd805be78038493d437dd1f7f3cc

commit_message:
Ensure network delete is handled by OVS agent

Fixes bug 1044574

The class OVSRpcCallbacks was deleted and the treatment of the RPC
callbacks moved into OVSQuantumAgent.

commit_message:
netns commands should always run in the root ns

fixes bug 1044542

Previously, some netns commands were executed in the context of the
namespace defined in the wrapper. These commands should be be executed in
the root namespace for the most reliable results.

Change-Id: I4915aa6f75af3f65ce2adb40360bcd841f549239

The swap and flavor attributes of a flavor are not in the spec. This
moves the properties so they are generated by extensions. The output

we now have a way to document these extra attributes and disable them.

Change-Id: Iee1cb1b1ee4116a38b90db581c38468d3d92afaf
'}, {'created': '2012-08-31 20:22:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add extensions for flavor swap and rxtx_factor

commit_message:
Add extensions for flavor swap and rxtx_factor

The swap and flavor attributes of a flavor are not in the spec. This
moves the properties so they are generated by extensions. The output
will not be changed if all extensions are enabled (by default), but
we now have a way to document these extra attributes and disable them.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iee1cb1b1ee4116a38b90db581c38468d3d92afaf

commit_message:
heat : run_tests.sh allow easier test selection

Allow each category of test (unit/funtional/pep) to be
more easily selected via CLI options, default with no args
remains unit+pep8

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat cli : initial heat-watch cloudwatch API client

Implements new client to demonstrate new Cloudwatch API

Currently only provides options for DescribeAlarms,
ListMetrics, PutMetricData and SetAlarmState

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3963a07694cec9af96d9d7369cc7d18d629fcd2d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-03 08:31:05.000000000', 'message': 'heat API : Implement initial CloudWatch API

Initial AWS-compatible CloudWatch API implementation
Supports the following API actions:
- DescribeAlarms : describe alarm/watch details
- ListMetrics : List watch metric datapoints
- PutMetricData : Create metric datapoint
- SetAlarmState : temporarily set alarm state

Skeleton implementation of all other TODO actions which
returns HeatAPINotImplementedError.

Only basic filtering parameters supported at this time.

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8628854a135fff07b675e85150ea0b50184ed2e1
'}, {'created': '2012-09-03 08:31:05.000000000', 'message': 'heat API : Implement initial CloudWatch API

Initial AWS-compatible CloudWatch API implementation
Supports the following API actions:
- DescribeAlarms : describe alarm/watch details
- ListMetrics : List watch metric datapoints
- PutMetricData : Create metric datapoint
- SetAlarmState : temporarily set alarm state

commit_message:
heat API : Implement initial CloudWatch API

Initial AWS-compatible CloudWatch API implementation
Supports the following API actions:
- DescribeAlarms : describe alarm/watch details
- ListMetrics : List watch metric datapoints
- PutMetricData : Create metric datapoint
- SetAlarmState : temporarily set alarm state

Skeleton implementation of all other TODO actions which
returns HeatAPINotImplementedError.

Only basic filtering parameters supported at this time.

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8628854a135fff07b675e85150ea0b50184ed2e1

In the bug report, you say:

  When list_networks() is called with a regular user, it returns networks owned by the current tenant and public networks. It is no problem.

Can we not ensure we connect to quantum as a regular user (using the auth_token from request context) and do an unfiltered list_networks() ?'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-08-22 16:22:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Question, won't -1 since I'm not sure off the top of my head about the answer"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-08-22 16:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nova already use the request context to access Quantum.

A user with admin role (e.g., "admin" user in devstack) can launch an instance.
In this case, even if I use the request context list_networks() returns all networks.
To handle this case I think filtered API call needs to be used.

(Ideally we may need to reconsider listing scope of list_network(), though it is too late for Folsom.
nova's server_list() with search options only returns instances owned by the current tenant even it is called by admin user, and if we specify all_tenants=True server_list() returns instances of all tenants. I feel nova's way is easier to use.)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-08-22 16:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add public network support when launching an instance.

Fixes bug 1039419.

A concept of public network has been implemented in Quantum.
To launch an instance connected to public network, we need to check public
network (whose 'shared' attribute is True) in addition to network owned by
the current tenant.

Change-Id: I128e68a8b9404056f74153bf8f576cfa8b438e19

In addition to this would it be possible to align the help texts. Please see below. 

Commands for API v2.0:

commit_message:
quatum: teach stack.sh Ryu dhcp agent

Quantum supports Ryu plugin and Ryu dhcp agent is comming[1]. And Ryu plugin
support for devstack is coming[2].
devstack doesn't support Quantum Ryu dhcp agent yet. So this patch adds it.

In order to test it, add "q-svc", "q-agn", q-dhcp, "ryu" to ENABLED_SERVICES
and set Q_PLUGIN to "ryu". Set RYU_EXT_INTERFACE if necessary.

fixes bug 1033352
This patch depends on Quantum Ryu dhcp agent support and devstack quantum
ryu plugin support.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10527/
    Quantum: Ryu dhcp agent support
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10117/
    Add support for the Quantum ryu plugin
[3] http://osrg.github.com/ryu/
    Ryu

Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>

The functions in the bin directory called the main function. When calling this directly the monkey patch was not invoked.

 quantum / bin / quantum-linuxbridge-agent

commit_message:
Fixes agent problem with RPC

Fixed bug 1044135

When quantum-openvswitch-agent or quantum-linuxbridge-agent were
called the eventlet monkey patch was not invoked.

Change-Id: Iafb7fd02d37415c3466213d28280bcb4573de4a8

commit_message:
Add method to manage 'put' requests in api-sample tests

Include a _do_put() method into tests_api_samples to generate api-samples to
put requests.

Change-Id: Id5019a1d31151e538f07c0863880da58ab3b4cc6

commit_message:
Changes to nova to support disk_qos attribute for flavor types

The changes include changes to instance_types model, sqlalchemy
migrations repository to add a new column "disk_qos" to the
instance_types table in nova db

Change-Id: Iffd2d875a60e4c6d0c715f29bf62873d56f088cc

commit_message:
Add ZeroMQ RPC backend

Now prevents more than one RPC backend selection.
(ZeroMQ, Qpid, and Rabbit are mutually exclusive)

Configure quantum and cinder to use ZeroMQ

Adds qpid to cinder config.

Change-Id: I229c4c632213a303d097d4a029e986598073665a

commit_message:
Plugin aware extensions should also be reset at each test setup

PluginAwareExtensionManager caches extension according plugin.
At each db plugin test setup, testing plugin and router are newly
created.
However, the extension manager held the extensions for first time
loaded plugin. Because of their cache.

So if a plugin conditional extension exists, it could not be loaded by
testing order.

Fixes bug 1043381.

Change-Id: Ic994aab61c3d67aa9d422594484049f41ff8b321

commit_message:
misc L3 fixes.

- fix iptables rules for handling inter-subnet traffic so that this
traffic is not SNATed when a gateway exists.

- handle remapping of floating ip from one internal ip to another

- enable ip forwarding on a per-network namespace basis.

- make metadata_ip optional. specifying it when no gateway is configured
results in a very log timeout.

Change-Id: I738094aeafe42cbf2c64eda3bb038ef1e58a6550

Good point about the potential to share code between plugins. I think this came up in an earlier review as well. There are some differences in these functions, for instance because linuxbridge does not support GRE, so its not simply a matter of moving code, and should probably wait.

Besides, I plan to propose that we combine the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins into a single plugin (with drivers in the agent) for Grizzly. The server side of linuxbridge is really a subset of openvswitch, and much of the agent code for the two plugins is similar as well.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-09-01 14:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

If we chose to do the validation in the plugin rather than before auth I think we should try to reuse the validation code across plugins in some manor. For example ovs and lb now both duplicate code for:

This is not really a big deal in my opinion though.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 14:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
expose openvswitch GRE tunnel_id via provider API

The provider:vlan_id extended attribute is renamed to
provider:segmentation_id, and the openvswitch plugin returns the
tunnel_id of GRE networks as this attribute.

Fixes bug 1044375. Final patch in series that fixes bug 1037341 and
bug 1035492.

Detailed changes:

- Rename provider:vlan_id to provider:segmentation_id.
- Use consts for providernet extension's attribute names
- Remove validation clause from provider:segmentation_id resource attribute map data.
- Validate provider:segmentation_id in linuxbridge and openvswitch plugins.
- Rename physical_id to segmentation_id in the openvswitch schema, plugin, and agent.

Change-Id: Ic023b30b6e3275955bcb8a09c7936035dacf3f87

subject: Add lease expiration management to ip recycling
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/1/check/gate-quantum-merge/1530 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/778 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/1398 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/1167 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/1168 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

In the case of a port delete the lease is removed immediately (or quasi immediately), as the notification will retrigger the reload of the lease file.

I wonder if we can use the same mechanism for both port updates and removals. 
We can either use notification in both cases, recycling ip even on port updates instead of putting them on hold (a bit chatty maybe), or put ips on hold even when they are deleted, and recycle them with the procedure implemented here for port updates.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

the overall strategy and code looks good, but in my testing it doesn't seem to be acting as I would expect.  If I spin up a vm on net1, it gets 10.0.0.3, i spin it down, spin up a new one immediately after on net1 again, and it again gets 10.0.0.3 .   I would have expected it would be 120 seconds (default dhcp_lease_timeout) before that IP was handled out again.  Or is the dhcp release stuff some how making this happen earlier?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ok, thanks for the clarification.  so the right way to test this would be to update a port, giving it a new IP, and making sure that its old IP is not immediately reused if I create a new VM?'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Hi,
Have a number of questions:
1. If a subnet has dhcp disabled, do we want to preform these operations?
2. Should a delete operation also perform the recycling of the expired entries.
3. A background task would be a nice solution, I am not sure how the locking works with the database. I am not sure that this is a must at the moment. It would be wise to try and optimize what we have at the moment (I need to think a bit about this). 
4. There are a number of edge cases that I am not sure how they are handled - for example say we have a range of 3 addresses. They are all allocated and released. If the user wants to get an IP will this fail until the timeout has passed?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why is tracking lease expiry preferable to sending DHCPRELEASE when an address is removed from a port?'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Deleting the port will immediately return the fixed ip back to the pool since the instance that was using the port will no longer use that IP.  Am I missing something where the IP could still be authorized for use after a port delete?

Port Updates are different.  The IPAllocation will be held until the expiration is reached.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

@mnewby DHCPRELEASE is a message from the client to the server.  In many cases when an api call is made to Quantum the client is unaware that its assignment has been changed until is tries to renew the lease.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/2/check/gate-quantum-merge/1565 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/813 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/1433 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/1202 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/1203 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I won't discount that I might be doing something wrong (so I won't -1), but this patch doesn't appear to prevent assignment of an ip address whose dhcp lease has not expired.  My steps to reproduce (devstack+this patch branch):

- create vm #1
- ip address is assigned
- destroy vm #1
- create vm #2
- vm #2 attempts to use the same ip as vm #1, which fails due to dnsmasq reporting the address as being still leased to the mac of vm #1.

Can anyone reproduce what I'm seeing?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The behaviour I am seeing is related to port deletion recycling assigned addresses immediately rather than holding those addresses until lease expiration (db_base_plugin_v2.py:1140).  The challenge is that IPAllocation has a foreign key relationship with Port, so holding the IP pending lease expiry will prevent port deletion.  This suggests either relaxing the foreign key constraint or holding IPs for deleted ports in a new table.   Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@mnewby You must be reading my mind I was working on testing both of those.  I was originally trying to avoid adding a table but that's the direction I've been working the last half hour."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/3/check/gate-quantum-merge/1569 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/3/check/gate-quantum-docs/817 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/3/check/gate-quantum-pep8/1437 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/3/check/gate-quantum-python26/1206 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12227/3/check/gate-quantum-python27/1207 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Nice work!  I've tested that the code now works as advertised.  

A few concerns:

 - See inline regarding fixture cleanup (the only change required for a +2)

- Maybe I missed them, but I didn't see tests change to check for the removal of the port id on allocated ips.  The fact that port deletion leaves behind unexpired IPAllocations is also not checked for.  I'd understand, though, if the reason for these omissions was a lack of pre-existing tests, and maybe that shouldn't be addressed here.

- How likely is it that lease renewal notifications are dropped or otherwise lost (say, message queue goes down) and in-use ip addresses start being mistakenly recycled?  Really this is just a discussion point, as I can't see a good solution beyond being able to modify address recycling behaviour (disable or start polling for lease expiration directly) if an anomaly is detected."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

mnewby- Good suggestions.  Some of the tests were done indirect by the mechanics of the db test suite.  I've added explicit tests:

test for port_id is none... line 1315 (test_hold_ip_address).
test for hold_ip being called on delete port... line 1824 (test_port_delete_holds_ip)"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Nice work!  Thank you for the test cleanup, additions and explanation.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

mnewby-  If a lease update notification is lost or delayed nothing bad will happen.  The DHCP agent will still hand out lease renewals; however the tuple in the db will make it look like the allocation is assigned but expired. If this happened, the bad state would exist for too long because lease renewals happen every lease period/2 (every minute with the default lease of 120s).  Quantum server will not reclaim the allocation because a port is still assigned.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-01 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add lease expiration management to ip recycling

Fixes bug 1022804

This is the 3rd and final patch for this bug.  This patch alters ip allocation
recycling to honor lease expiration. Allocations that are in the
expiration wait state have null port_ids.

Change-Id: Ib7960b142eb15733c6418b01973d02a827634cb6

commit_message:
*-list command shows only limited fields normally.

Bug #1036051

We add list_columns in list commands to limit the output columns.
The behaviour is overriden if we use -c in command.

Change-Id: I0fa6c73cd7270d86aff01d3790d59c8d4e8a235a

commit_message:
Fix BatchAction class incongruence between documentation and code
Fixes launchpad bug #1044424

The BatchAction class in the tables package define the success_url variable in the docs but use completion_url in the code.

Change-Id: Ia93eeee4eccb4250d4b0984f38585175de738907

commit_message:
Log level for BaseContextMiddleware should be warn

The current log level is error for BaseContextMiddleware.
It is toned down to warn in this patch.

Fixes bug 1043374

Change-Id: I468183b374f06b0afad3d559fdb2c09ac0663105

The v2 API didnt generate any notifications. It should
send same as those that v1 API has

Fixes bug 1038552

commit_message:
Allow filtering flavors by name, minRam, minDisk

- The filtering by name is filtered via findAll which is much more
inneficient than filtering on server since not supported by the API.

Change-Id: I812d7e000397ae729ca1a52296f27bcfbc86869e

commit_message:
Allow filtering flavors by name.

- Add a filter by name when listing flavors.
- Historically clients were retrieving all VMs name and filtering after
  we are now providing that filtering capability directly from nova.

Change-Id: I4bf2a7c80eceb0d0c5227c10bdcae97279bb951e

messages:

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:51:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This seems reasonable, but we need to explicitely say that this value is optional in the docstring here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/volume/manager.py#L275

as well as the same place in cinder. The reason it should be optional is nova-volumes/cinder should support connections from things other than instances."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

you should also note that the attach call passes in a uuid and actually stores it in the db, so consider just modifying volume_attach to make a call down to the driver. This might be safer because initialize_connection could theoretically be called multiple times.'}, {'account_id': 4159, 'date': '2012-08-16 21:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-16 22:13:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-15 17:52:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add instance_uuid to initialize_connection.

The volume driver may want to know which guest is going to be
attached to a volume. initialize_connection seems like the proper
place for this. This patch simply adds the instance_uuid to the
connector dict fetched from the virt driver which is then passed to
the volume driver.

Change-Id: If67ad34b19c2b1abce0c8b45444187e019080423
'}, {'created': '2012-08-16 21:58:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add instance_uuid to initialize_connection.

The volume driver may want to know which guest is going to be
attached to a volume. The manager now calls down into the driver
on attach_volume and detach_volume.

Change-Id: If67ad34b19c2b1abce0c8b45444187e019080423
'}, {'created': '2012-08-17 15:43:34.000000000', 'message': 'Call driver for attach/detach_volume.

The volume driver may want to know which guest is going to be
attached to a volume. The manager now calls down into the driver
on attach_volume and detach_volume.

Change-Id: If67ad34b19c2b1abce0c8b45444187e019080423
'}]
commit_message:
Call driver for attach/detach_volume.

The volume driver may want to know which guest is going to be
attached to a volume. The manager now calls down into the driver
on attach_volume and detach_volume.

Change-Id: If67ad34b19c2b1abce0c8b45444187e019080423

commit_message:
Clear up the .gitignore file

1.Remove duplicate items
2.Sort to alphabetical order
3.Remove "*.sw[po]" instead "*.swp" and "*.swo" for pass
bundling test.

Fixes: bug #1039898
Change-Id: Id8e03ecce6d2ab6d823a992a3a225b5ceb44aa80

commit_message:
Remove unused flags

* region_list
* aws_access_key_id

* osapi_scheme
* osapi_path
* metadata_host
* metadata_port
* default_project
* default_image

* vpn_image_id

* auth_token_ttl
* bandwith_poll_interval
* start_guests_on_host_boot
* resume_guests_state_on_host_boot
* default_ephemeral_format
* use_ipv6
* allow_resize_to_same_host
* zombie_instance_updated_at_window
* isolated_images
* isolated_hosts

Change-Id: Ia3d5ac7d7c983845b5411e2fc1f49eb579e3280f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-30 21:38:32.000000000', 'message': 'Address race condition from concurrent task state update

task_state acts like a guard to avoid concurrent tasks to be
scheduled. There might be two race conditions:

 1) two tasks are concurrently accepted by api, check task_state to be
 None and allow the tasks to be executed concurrently.

 2) one ordinary task is running, so that task_state is set. The delete
 task is accepted at API, and will "take over" and change task_state to
 DELETING. However the first task may continue to update task_state or
 set it to None as it finishes.

This patch specifies current expected task_state when updating task_state.
If unexpected state is met, abort the task without updating. Various
compute tests are fixed accordingly to set the pre condition of the
task state.

Part of bug 1037372
Change-Id: I5fdf0946c728a47febb56ad468043a828b2736c8
'}, {'created': '2012-08-31 01:03:13.000000000', 'message': 'Address race condition from concurrent task state update

commit_message:
Address race condition from concurrent task state update

task_state acts like a guard to avoid concurrent tasks to be
scheduled. There might be two race conditions:

 1) two tasks are concurrently accepted by api, check task_state to be
 None and allow the tasks to be executed concurrently.

 2) one ordinary task is running, so that task_state is set. The delete
 task is accepted at API, and will "take over" and change task_state to
 DELETING. However the first task may continue to update task_state or
 set it to None as it finishes.

This patch specifies current expected task_state when updating task_state.
If unexpected state is met, abort the task without updating. Various
compute tests are fixed accordingly to set the pre condition of the
task state.

Part of bug 1037372
Change-Id: I5fdf0946c728a47febb56ad468043a828b2736c8

commit_message:
Avoid leaking security group quota reservations

Fixes bug #1043765

If you attempt to create a security group where one already exists using
that name, a security groups quota reservation is leaked. Fix by
ensuring the reservation is rolled back in all failure cases.

Add a check to the tests to ensure that a reservation isn't leaked in
any of our sad path tests for security group creation.

Change-Id: I22d6e4a0452d3ac7a23056b0a4aee6f7dd135e30

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-31 09:38:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deallocate_fixed_ip invocation

Fixes bug 1043905.

The host parameter was not passed to deallocate_fixed_ip method, so that
the deallocation tried to do a remote call to another host, which timed
out, thus instance termination failed.

Change-Id: I18d6de31d15767a45f389ae14769985c3951d560
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deallocate_fixed_ip invocation

Fixes bug 1043905.

The host parameter was not passed to deallocate_fixed_ip method, so that
the deallocation tried to do a remote call to another host, which timed
out, thus instance termination failed.

Change-Id: I18d6de31d15767a45f389ae14769985c3951d560

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-30 22:00:12.000000000', 'message': 'Makes sample testing handle out of order output

Changes the output comparison to compare nested python objects. Since
there may be lists of objects in the output, it compares each object
in a list against every other object looking for a match. This is
somewhat inefficient, but since our examples are all relatively short,
the performance impact is negligible.

Change-Id: I0fb02beb9a278f6f93d9b0eaf6d55fcd2a3c96b7
'}, {'created': '2012-08-30 22:22:17.000000000', 'message': 'Makes sample testing handle out of order output

Changes the output comparison to compare nested python objects. This
assumes assumes that lists in the expected output will always sort
in the same order as lists in the actual output.

Change-Id: I0fb02beb9a278f6f93d9b0eaf6d55fcd2a3c96b7
'}, {'created': '2012-08-31 17:07:13.000000000', 'message': 'Makes sample testing handle out of order output

Changes the output comparison to compare nested python objects. This
assumes assumes that lists in the expected output will always sort
in the same order as lists in the actual output.

Change-Id: I0fb02beb9a278f6f93d9b0eaf6d55fcd2a3c96b7
'}]
commit_message:
Makes sample testing handle out of order output

Changes the output comparison to compare nested python objects. This
assumes assumes that lists in the expected output will always sort
in the same order as lists in the actual output.

Change-Id: I0fb02beb9a278f6f93d9b0eaf6d55fcd2a3c96b7

commit_message:
Adds api sample testing for versions

This patch tests api samples for the versions resource in json and
xml. It makes a small modification to the integrated api client to
support making requests above /v2/tenant_id.

This also fixes an uncovered bug in the link handling in the versions
resource.

Fixes bug 1041426

Change-Id: Ie898ef3822fa250def2e0fa407a0968275262260

commit_message:
Remove scheduler RPC API version 1.x

Like with the compute RPC API, we're unlikely to still work well with
RPC client using older 1.x version because of DB schema changes.

In that case, we may as well remove 1.x support in Folsom and rip out
the potentially buggy backwards compat code. This should also make
backporting fixes from Grizzly easier.

Deployers following trunk can upgrade all their nodes to use the version
2.0 API before deploying this commit.

Change-Id: Iee099751bda9637da5e134357d28e89d5fba9895

commit_message:
Add version 2.0 of the scheduler RPC API

Like we did for the compute RPC API, add version 2.0 of the scheduler
API while still retaining 1.x support. This allows all services to
be updated with 2.0 support before 1.x support is removed.

Change-Id: If438d5b6f521ea4c487d1490d4b8cf6547ba5c72

implementor of the 'create_volumes' RPC method.

Change-Id: Ic718d54d938059b034b78bc287668b0b9fa27f94

commit_message:
Fixed boot from snapshot failure.

Passed the snapshot_id to cinder client from create API. Previously it was
failing since snapshot was being passed instead of snapshot_id.

Fixes LP: #1029211

Change-Id: I4aa1aca9067b2a282b9b46d909ef8342bf933a46

commit_message:
Clean up non-spec output in flavor extensions

Adds option to cache flavors in the request object like instances.
Modifies the flavorextradata extension to use the cache and optimizes
tests. Adds flavor_disabled extension to control the extra data and
includes tests. Fixes api samples to show the new extension.

Fixes bug 1043585

Change-Id: Ie89df24a2891e3869d3fb604e07c79e8c913f290

commit_message:
Adds api sample testing for extensions endpoint

Includes minor updates to base class to handle multiline descriptions
and makes the extensions endpoint use a sorted list of extensions.

Change-Id: I3604e3969b892646d5bbe08af44d454ee40e6f9e

commit_message:
Use event.listen() instead of deprecated listeners kwarg

Fixes bug 1031405

The listeners kwarg is deprecated in SQLAlchemy 0.7.0. Since 0.7.3 is
the minimum required version of SQLAlchemy, use the new event.listen()
API instead.

Change-Id: I1b851e197c04b131ae96e814780b04e6dcdeeb1a

commit_message:
Deprecate 'bandwith_poll_interval'

Replace it with 'bandwidth_poll_interval', which is spelled correctly.
This will allow the old option to work as long as it's specified.  A
warning will be logged.

Fixes bug 1036407

We can remove the old option in a future release.

Change-Id: I611de5492da18d122767c1dc937ba00ab98a1e9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-29 15:41:43.000000000', 'message': "Stop using scheduler RPC API magic

If a scheduler RPC message isn't handled directly by a SchedulerManager
method, the __getattr__() fallback passes the message to a driver
method in the form of schedule_${method}() and, if that doesn't exist,
instead calls the schedule() method supplying the topic and method
args.

This is pretty bizarre stuff and we appear to only use it in two cases:

  1) live_migration - this is how the schedule_live_migration()
     method in the driver gets called, but the side-effect is that
     we require the client to pass a topic argument which is never
     used. This would be much more sanely handled with an explicit
     SchedulerManager.live_migration() method.

  2) create_volume - the volume API asks the scheduler to pick a
     target host for create_volume() using this method. This would
     be easily handled with an SchedulerManager.create_volume()
     method.

Change-Id: I1047489d85ac51d8d36fea1c4eb858df638ce349
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using scheduler RPC API magic

If a scheduler RPC message isn't handled directly by a SchedulerManager
method, the __getattr__() fallback passes the message to a driver
method in the form of schedule_${method}() and, if that doesn't exist,
instead calls the schedule() method supplying the topic and method
args.

This is pretty bizarre stuff and we appear to only use it in two cases:

  1) live_migration - this is how the schedule_live_migration()
     method in the driver gets called, but the side-effect is that
     we require the client to pass a topic argument which is never
     used. This would be much more sanely handled with an explicit
     SchedulerManager.live_migration() method.

  2) create_volume - the volume API asks the scheduler to pick a
     target host for create_volume() using this method. This would
     be easily handled with an SchedulerManager.create_volume()
     method.

Change-Id: I1047489d85ac51d8d36fea1c4eb858df638ce349

commit_message:
Remove compute RPC API version 1.x

Now that we have RPC API versions 1.x and 2.0, we could choose to
continue to support version 1.x in Folsom and only remove it in
Grizzly.

This, in theory, would allow smoother upgrades of older Folsom
versions to the final Folsom version. However, in reality, we
most likely made DB schema changes which affect the compute service
and would prevent such a smooth upgrade anyway.

Removing 1.x support now removes a lot of potentially buggy backwards
compat code from the release and will also make backporting fixes from
Grizzly to Folsom easier.

Change-Id: Ic18017a16c5bffee85a43db65ff17283599a27ba

subject: Add version 2.0 of compute RPC API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1711, 'name': 'Yun Mao', 'email': 'yunmao@gmail.com', 'username': 'yunmao'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5220, 'name': 'Joshua Colp', 'email': 'jcolp@joshua-colp.com', 'username': 'jcolp'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-28 15:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cool stuff!  I was actually talking to Joshua Colp about this yesterday and he was going to work on it.  I'll explain the approach we discussed to see if you like it more or less than what you've done here.

1) Update all client side code (rpcapi.py) to include a "currently implemented version" (1.last).  Right now the messages only include a minimum required version.

2) On the server side (manager.py), update the API to 2.0 and strip out all of the backwards compatibility stuff.  Make it so '2.0' is the same as 1.last, but without any support for older 1.X stuff.  Make a way to specify a version that is also compatible. So, it would say the current version was '2.0', but is also compatible with '1.last'.

3) Change the rpc dispatcher code to allow messages where the currently implemented version specified in the message is included in the list of versions also acceptable (1.last).

The advantage would be that this intermediary step with a proxy class isn't necessary.  You would have to update all nodes to 1.last before you started updating to 2.0.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-28 16:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

After thinking through this some more and talking it over with Mark, I like this approach better.  The #1 reason is that this approach avoids making the version handling semantics any more complicated.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-28 16:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-28 16:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Russell'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-28 18:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Nice work, Mark!'}, {'account_id': 5220, 'date': '2012-08-28 20:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Russell: Yes, I thought about this as well while I was flying and came to the same conclusion - stuff would just get messy.

Mark: Looks good to me but I wonder if the RPC API versioning documentation should be extended to describe/cover this approach for others.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-31 15:55:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nits: if we are making a "major" upgrade anyway, I wonder if it makes sense to put the instance parameter the next one after context?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-31 15:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We can actually change the order of parameters at any time because they get passed in from the RPC dispatcher as kwargs'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-31 15:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 16:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 16:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build successful

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-28 14:56:15.000000000', 'message': "Add version 2.0 of compute RPC API

RPC API versioning is helpful because (a) it gives useful error messages
if there is a version mismatch and (b) it allows you to update to a new
version of the API on the server side before updating the client side.

However, we still regularly encounter DB changes which force the client
and server side to be updated together. This will not be resolved until
no-db-compute is fully implemented.

It's safe to say that RPC API clients using version 1.0 will not work
with a version 1.44 compute manager (because of DB schema changes). The
issue, then, is that continuing to support 1.0 clients in the Folsom
release seems pointless and the alternative of removing legacy RPC API
support would mean a lot less cruft code in the release.

Before removing version 1.x of the compute RPC API, we add version 2.0
while still retaining 1.x support. This gives users the option of
upgrading all compute RPC API users to use version 2.0 before version
1.x support is removed from compute nodes.

Change-Id: I1c74b36a84d770b0af5ca33062e069a545537ee2
"}, {'created': '2012-08-28 16:59:21.000000000', 'message': "Add version 2.0 of compute RPC API

RPC API versioning is helpful because (a) it gives useful error messages
if there is a version mismatch and (b) it allows you to update to a new
version of the API on the server side before updating the client side.

However, we still regularly encounter DB changes which force the client
and server side to be updated together. This will not be resolved until
no-db-compute is fully implemented.

It's safe to say that RPC API clients using version 1.0 will not work
with a version 1.44 compute manager (because of DB schema changes). The
issue, then, is that continuing to support 1.0 clients in the Folsom
release seems pointless and the alternative of removing legacy RPC API
support would mean a lot less cruft code in the release.

Before removing version 1.x of the compute RPC API, we add version 2.0
while still retaining 1.x support. This gives users the option of
upgrading all compute RPC API users to use version 2.0 before version
1.x support is removed from compute nodes.

Change-Id: I1c74b36a84d770b0af5ca33062e069a545537ee2
"}]
commit_message:
Add version 2.0 of compute RPC API

RPC API versioning is helpful because (a) it gives useful error messages
if there is a version mismatch and (b) it allows you to update to a new
version of the API on the server side before updating the client side.

However, we still regularly encounter DB changes which force the client
and server side to be updated together. This will not be resolved until
no-db-compute is fully implemented.

It's safe to say that RPC API clients using version 1.0 will not work
with a version 1.44 compute manager (because of DB schema changes). The
issue, then, is that continuing to support 1.0 clients in the Folsom
release seems pointless and the alternative of removing legacy RPC API
support would mean a lot less cruft code in the release.

Before removing version 1.x of the compute RPC API, we add version 2.0
while still retaining 1.x support. This gives users the option of
upgrading all compute RPC API users to use version 2.0 before version
1.x support is removed from compute nodes.

Change-Id: I1c74b36a84d770b0af5ca33062e069a545537ee2

commit_message:
Implement volume quota support in Cinder

parital fix for bug 1023311
  * To use needs cinderclient https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11509/
  * Updates quota classes with changes in Nova
  * Adds needed quota related DB tables
  * Updates test_quota to reflect changes in Nova
  * Adds absolute limits and empty rate limit functions
  * Updates test/integration/test_volume to make it work w/ above changes

Change-Id: I221c7a9dc51a2bb9bf7228c056f63ba9546cf5f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-23 20:56:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deallocate_fixed_ip() call by unifying signature

deallocate_fixed_ip() is defined in 3 classes with incompatible
signatures:

RPCAllocateFixedIP:
deallocate_fixed_ip(self, context, address, host, **kwargs)
NetworkManager:
deallocate_fixed_ip(self, context, address, **kwargs)
FlatManager:
deallocate_fixed_ip(self, context, address, **kwargs)

There is a non-trivial multiple inheritance relationship among
them. The complication leads to incorrect function call signatures
(see bug 1024789). The kwargs magic is also never used, and discarded
during rpc calls anyway.

This patch makes the call signature exactly the same for all
deallocate_fixed_ip() definitions, drops kwargs and fixes bug
1024789.

Change-Id: I9c139810d4a5c93fa9f50b89a07bfe44e73e6c8a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deallocate_fixed_ip() call by unifying signature

deallocate_fixed_ip() is defined in 3 classes with incompatible
signatures:

RPCAllocateFixedIP:
deallocate_fixed_ip(self, context, address, host, **kwargs)
NetworkManager:
deallocate_fixed_ip(self, context, address, **kwargs)
FlatManager:
deallocate_fixed_ip(self, context, address, **kwargs)

There is a non-trivial multiple inheritance relationship among
them. The complication leads to incorrect function call signatures
(see bug 1024789). The kwargs magic is also never used, and discarded
during rpc calls anyway.

This patch makes the call signature exactly the same for all
deallocate_fixed_ip() definitions, drops kwargs and fixes bug
1024789.

Change-Id: I9c139810d4a5c93fa9f50b89a07bfe44e73e6c8a

Connect to heat client, add accessor method, and fix ip check

Search server list for IP based on the PhysicalResourceId, not an arbitrary
server name. Wait until stack create event before obtaining value.

[{'created': '2012-08-28 20:20:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix creation of iscsi targets

Previously when creating iscsi volumes, we were using

tgt-admin -e -c <config file> --update volume-id

Unfortunately the side affect of this is that tgt-admin
removed other volumes that wasnt connected to an iscsi
connector. Which is obvlously not what we want.

In order to fix this we create the targets.conf for the
volume but we call tgt-admin --update icssi qualified name.
We also set the tid in the configuration file now as well.

Change-Id: I9060a43208df5b79e9b17dadcab8bc0a8eeef55e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix creation of iscsi targets

Previously when creating iscsi volumes, we were using

tgt-admin -e -c <config file> --update volume-id

Unfortunately the side affect of this is that tgt-admin
removed other volumes that weren't connected to an iscsi
connector. Which is obvlously not what we want.

In order to fix this we create the targets.conf for the
volume but we call tgt-admin --update icssi qualified name.

We're dropping the use of iscsi_targets table when using TgtAdm.
Compatability for other target admin types is maintained.

Fixes LP: #1038062

Change-Id: I9060a43208df5b79e9b17dadcab8bc0a8eeef55e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

[{'created': '2012-08-30 19:11:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update zmq context cleanup to use term.

Updates the RPC cleanup function for the zmq RPC driver
to use Context.term() instead of Context.destroy().

This allows the Nova code to work with older version (pre 2.1.10)
of zmq and also avoids the newer destroy() call which is not
threadsafe.

Fixes LP Bug #1044004.

Change-Id: I07a200d4b216c0c1e155b57588295b35a237576c
'}, {'created': '2012-08-31 14:06:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update zmq context cleanup to use term.

Updates the RPC cleanup function for the zmq RPC driver
to use Context.term() instead of Context.destroy().

This allows the Nova code to work with older versions (pre 2.1.10)
of pyzmq. The Context term() function seems to do the job just as
well as destroy() (and is also thread safe) so lets just use it instead.

Fixes LP Bug #1044004.

Change-Id: I07a200d4b216c0c1e155b57588295b35a237576c
'}]
commit_message:
Update zmq context cleanup to use term.

Updates the RPC cleanup function for the zmq RPC driver
to use Context.term() instead of Context.destroy().

This allows the Nova code to work with older versions (pre 2.1.10)
of pyzmq. The Context term() function seems to do the job just as
well as destroy() (and is also thread safe) so lets just use it instead.

Fixes LP Bug #1044004.

Change-Id: I07a200d4b216c0c1e155b57588295b35a237576c

commit_message:
Add cinder- prefix to all binaries.

Renames clear_rabbit_queues and volume-usuage-audit binaries
so that they are prefixed with 'cinder-'.

As part of this change the clear_rabbit_queues binary was changed
to use dashes instead of underscores for consistency with the rest
of the cinder binaries.

Fixes LP Bug #1044386.

Change-Id: I7692a543cc67af2d342a64b84626de38c0a64f81

commit_message:
heat engine : Add set_watch_state engine RPC action

Add set_watch_state which allows a watch/alarm state
to be temporarily overridden, simplified asynchronous
version following review/discussion

Change-Id: I9f1424007fc16d1cec2f7dc504600455fe5ab3bb
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-08-22 22:28:00.000000000', 'message': "Make glance image service check base exception classes

Fixes bug 1039675

glanceclient can raise HTTPNotFound (as well as NotFound) it appears,
but glance image service is only converting NotFound ->
InstanceNotFound.  Same applies to 'Forbidden' and other exceptions.

This patch converts 'exc_type is NotFound'-like checks to use
'isinstance' instead, which will cover HTTPNotFound, etc.

Also add missing glance/image tests that weren't in Cinder

Change-Id: I8787598daccf401a26d9397946ecd55f89ff62b3
"}]
commit_message:
Make glance image service check base exception classes

Fixes bug 1039675

glanceclient can raise HTTPNotFound (as well as NotFound) it appears,
but glance image service is only converting NotFound ->
InstanceNotFound.  Same applies to 'Forbidden' and other exceptions.

This patch converts 'exc_type is NotFound'-like checks to use
'isinstance' instead, which will cover HTTPNotFound, etc.

Also add missing glance/image tests that weren't in Cinder

Change-Id: I8787598daccf401a26d9397946ecd55f89ff62b3

subject: prevent invalid deletion of ports using by L3 devices
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/1403/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/1041/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

The code looks good to me. However, I would consider whether a different approach is feasible, since from an architectural point of view making the L2 plugin explicitly aware of the presence of the L3 plugin is not ideal IMHO.

Hoever with the mixin model we do not really have two plugin, but rather a L2+L3 plugin, so I won't stand in the way of merging this patch into master.

The different approach I am envisioning is based on the consideration that if the port has a "device owner" this should have priority over tenant ownership, and that a similar problem might exist for the dhcp agent, as one doesn't want the tenant to delete the dhcp server port (not sure if this has been addressed in a different way).
So we might enhance the Quantum context by disallowing tenants to delete ports owned by a 3rd party, be it the dhcp server, a router interface, a router gateway or floating IPs.
The l3_db plugin having direct access to the l2 plugin should be able to skip this check. External service (if any) which own ports might use an appropriately elevated context.

I don't know if any of this is feasible. Should it be not feasible, or be too complex/disruptive, I will be happy to +2 this patch.

Inline comments are minor nits.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Dan,

I can summarize my thoughts as follows: If we believe L2 and L3 capabilities might be offered by different plugins, then check_l3_port as an attribute of delete_port should be considered carefully; otherwise we might move the check in db_base_class, and if the instance is also an instance of the L3 mixin, do the check on port deletion.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

replies inline.  awaiting some responses from both garyk and salvatore on their opinions on possible tweaks.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

new patch uploaded.  There are two high-level discussion points not adressed: 

- should we make device_id and device_owner admin only in terms of writes
- should L3 extension specific logic be put in DB-base?  

I'd like to suggest that we merge this patch and handle both issues separately.  There's a second L3 patch that I will be proposing where we can address this question."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 14:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me
