commit_message:
prevent invalid deletion of ports using by L3 devices

bug 1039947

The bug noticed that an admin user could delete a port that stored
the underlying IP allocation for a floating IP.  This patch prevents
the direction deletion of ports via the API for ports that are used as
router interfaces, router gateways, of for floating IPs.

Add a unit test to check such an invalid delete, and also updates
unit tests to avoid them tripping over the new checks.

Change-Id: Ief28e3181583428d55259275a7c21151a4a4fa9b

Updates the RPC cleanup function for the zmq RPC driver
to use Context.term() instead of Context.destroy().

of pyzmq. The Context term() function seems to do the job just as well as

commit_message:
Update zmq context cleanup to use term.

Updates the RPC cleanup function for the zmq RPC driver
to use Context.term() instead of Context.destroy().

This allows the Nova code to work with older versions (pre 2.1.10)
of pyzmq. The Context term() function seems to do the job just as well as
destroy() (and is also thread safe) so lets just use it instead.

Fixes LP Bug #1044004.

Change-Id: Ifadd2c19914abfe5dbb58310d21eb6c78563fb82

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-31 09:46:34.000000000', 'message': 'Allow non-string items in the creds dict.

The generic checking in policy allows us to match against data from the
creds_dict using a very simple syntax. For example, in policy.json if
you had something like:

"some_action": [["project_id:foo"]]

it would only allow project foo to perform that action, but something
like:

"some_action": [["is_admin:True"]]

where is_admin is a boolean fails.

This modifies the check to convert the value to unicode before
attempting to compare it. It includes a test.

Fixes bug 1039132

Change-Id: I0e53a6ea2709212d4a1536f901bcf1e717a232ca
'}]
commit_message:
Allow non-string items in the creds dict.

The generic checking in policy allows us to match against data from the
creds_dict using a very simple syntax. For example, in policy.json if
you had something like:

"some_action": [["project_id:foo"]]

it would only allow project foo to perform that action, but something
like:

"some_action": [["is_admin:True"]]

where is_admin is a boolean fails.

This modifies the check to convert the value to unicode before
attempting to compare it. It includes a test.

Fixes bug 1039132

Change-Id: I0e53a6ea2709212d4a1536f901bcf1e717a232ca

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I7fcce74b358e27901b74922af35d4ea529366c81

commit_message:
Makes api extension names consistent

We have a few extensions that are using strange _ in their names.
The Class names have to be named this way to be picked up properly
by the loading code, but the user facing name is much nicer in
PascalCase, so this switches them over.

Change-Id: I9326410add1317ef006559d5ca2205a4487371e2

commit_message:
Cosmetic, comment and text cleanups

* functions
* stack.sh
* stackrc
* unstack.sh

A recent commit to stack.sh broke the RST formatting done by shocco to
produce the HTML-formatted files on devstack.org.  A bunch of comment
and spacing fixes were done (ala pep8 if there were such a thing for
shell scripts).

The only non-comment changes made were to the content of some error
messages.

Fixes bug 1042271

Change-Id: Id1c74cf25c03c4f18ed741f8026e36b0d4a598dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-20 23:11:14.000000000', 'message': 'refactor get_engine to accept sql_connection

Refactor the call to get_engine so that it can optionally take
sql_connection as a parameter. This should allow parts of Nova
(eg. the bare-metal virt driver) to use their own get_session call to
instantiate a connection to a separate database back-end.

Change-Id: Ifbccb9e51ac56954eae26e9b08b084fb3c1f70ad
'}, {'created': '2012-08-21 21:07:09.000000000', 'message': 'refactor session.py to allow >1 db backend

Refactor session.py so that FLAGS.sql_connection can be overridden when
calling get_session. This allows modules, such as bare-metal, to maintain
a separate database back-end connection.

Change-Id: Ifbccb9e51ac56954eae26e9b08b084fb3c1f70ad
'}]
commit_message:
refactor session.py to allow >1 db backend

Refactor session.py so that FLAGS.sql_connection can be overridden when
calling get_session. This allows modules, such as bare-metal, to maintain
a separate database back-end connection.

Change-Id: Ifbccb9e51ac56954eae26e9b08b084fb3c1f70ad

commit_message:
Modified code PEP8 warning.

*Find more than one space after keywords, then eat one.
*Make sure every continuation line is aligned with the first character after
the top parenthesis in the top line.

Change-Id: Id3eb1ec728bc3329a859d0817d61b639019ffe8b

commit_message:
Update stack.sh for Quantum openvswitch plugin changes

With support for multiple physical networks being added to the Quantum
openvswitch plugin via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11388/, the
configuration needed to enable either tunneling or VLANs has
changed.

See http://wiki.openstack.org/ConfigureOpenvswitch for configuration
and usage details.

Change-Id: I82ca587e097a0f9612af46f2f89a19ac27c73432

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (5 inline comments)

Bob a few comments online.

Overall I am slightly confused. I think I've not quite understood how this patch is supposed to work, and I apologise for that.

My understanding is that this patch tries to allocate a distinct tunnel id for each network (whereas beforehand all networks were using the same tunnel mesh and were isolated through tags). Is that correct?

However It seems the allocated tunnel id is than allocated still on the tag attribute of the OVS port object, which is supposed to be for vlans only."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (5 inline comments)

I think my confusion starts from the fact that I was expecting to review a change to the open vswitch plugin to support the provider networks extensions, whereas this patch is supposed to be "part 1" of a rearchitect of the open vswitch plugin itself.

I say this because merging the two agents and reworking the plugin so that each network gets its own tunnel id and (I guess) tunnel grid appears to be as a significant change in the architecture of the plugin itself.

This is probably a rhetorical question, but have you consider whether it would have been possible to support the provider networks extension without doing so many changes in the plugin itself?

PS: I apologize in advance for any dumb comment ;)'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Hi,
It is not clear to me how the flat network works. I have yet to understand how multiple NICs also work. My feeling here is that the flow entry output ports may need to be updated (maybe I just do not understand) or this is via the patch ports.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (6 inline comments)

See my responses to the in-line comments.

I think any confusion is likely caused by the agent code not being fully updated yet, along with the terminology changing a bit. 

The changes in the DB schema are to replace the separate VLAN and tunnel modes (that each interpreted the vlan_id field differently) with a single mode that supports tunnels, VLANs, and flat networks concurrently. This requires the bindings for VLANs (and flat networks) to also specify the physical_network, with each distinct physical_network having an independent space of VLAN IDs. So a separate table is now used for the allocation of keys for tunnels, which do not involve a physical_network and are unrelated to any VLAN ID spaces.

As before with tunnel mode, and soon in all cases, each distinct network used on a node maps to a distinct local VLAN ID on br-int. These local VLAN IDs are allocated locally in the agent and are not the same as the external VLAN ID or tunnel key that is allocated by the server plugin for communication across nodes.

As before, for tunnels, the flow connecting the local br-int VLAN to br-tun strips the local VLAN ID and specifies the tunnel key for outgoing packets, and adds the local VLAN ID for incoming packets based on which tunnel key is matched.

The new way of doing VLAN and flat networks will work similarly in that a local VLAN ID identifying the network within br-int will be independent of the VLAN ID used externally.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/1370/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-docs/618/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python26/1007/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/1008/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress

This is still a WIP. Both RPC and DB modes work now for GRE tunnels. I've also renamed tunnel_key back to tunnel_id to avoid confusion, since OVS uses the tunnel id term. 

Another update, hopefully later today, will extend the OVSQuantumTunnelAgent.port_bound function to support VLANs and flat networks.

To address Salvatore's most recent comments:

I agree this may appear to be a "re-archtect" of the plugin, but its actually not changing the way the existing tunnel mode works at all in the agent. 

I'll try to address what I think is confusion regarding "reworking the plugin so that each network gets its own tunnel id and (I guess) tunnel grid". Since the plugin did not used to support tunnels and VLANs concurrently, it previously re-used the vlan_id allocation mechanism in tunnel mode to allocate tunnel_ids. Now that the plugin supports both concurrently, separate DB tables are used to track the allocation states of vlan_ids (which are now per physical network) and tunnel_ids. This only effects the plugin, not the agent. The DB table schema storing the network bindings has been enhanced to support multiple network types, but this change is absolutely necessary to implement provider networks, and this change has minimal impact on the way the agent handles GRE tunnels.

Regarding "whether it would have been possible to support the provider networks extension without doing so many changes in the plugin itself?", the difficulty was that provider flat networks and provider VLANs both needed to be supported regardless of whether non-provider networks were realized as GRE tunnels or as VLANs. Once provider VLANs are supported, using the same mechanism to support non-provider VLANs seems to make sense, and allows the separate VLAN-only OVSQuantumAgent class to be (soon) eliminated. 

-Bob'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/11388/6/check/gate-quantum-merge/1450 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/11388/6/check/gate-quantum-python26/1087 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11388/6/check/gate-quantum-python27/1088 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (3 inline comments)

Looks quite good to me.

The only bit I still have to understand is how the provider:vlan_id attribute is enforced on a tunneled network. From what I gather, it seems the br-<phy> bridges are still patches to br-int through veths. I was expecting them to be patched to br-tun, but I don't have at the moment a strong opinion on the matter. I will put the patch on a multi-node testbed and hopefully there should not be any problem.

One thing I noticed is that we probably will need to document the changes in the OVS plugin. Currently the README point to a page on openvswitch.org. 
Have you already considered a plan for documenting how the ovs plugin now works?"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(8 inline comments)

Hi,
I have added in a number of inline comments.
I was using devstack to check the flat networks. I was unable to send traffic from a vm to the network. It looks like there is a problem with the way in which the flow entries are built. Can you please clarify why port_bound only treats the "gre" network type and not the rest?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

This is ready for review. The openvswitch plugin now supports tunnels, flat networks, and vlan networks simultaneously, with multiple physical network interfaces. 

Usage is similar to the linuxbridge plugin, except that physical network names are mapped on the agent to pre-configured OVS bridge names rather than to physical interface names.

The changes since the last patch set have mainly been to the agent.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (8 inline comments)

I believe the external connectivity did not work in Gary's test because he had not added a physical NIC as a port on his br-<phys_net> OVS bridge. This needs to be done manually, being careful to move any existing IP on the NIC to the bridge without losing connectivity.

As explained in the in-line comment, explicit flows for each MAC address are not needed on br-<phys_net> because the OVS bridge is in normal learning mode. They are necessary in br-tun because it is configured to drop all packets by default."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (6 inline comments)

Responding to Salvatore's comments:

1) Currently, provider:vlan_id does not apply to tunnels. If we want to expose tunnel_ids in the provider extension, I suggest we do that via a separate bug fix where we also rename provider:vlan_id to provider:physical_id. At the same time, I'd like to shorten all the provider attribute names to "provider:type", "provider:phys_net", and "provider:phys_id".

2) You are correct that the physical network bridges are patched to the integration bridge through veths. Since different physical networks can have overlapping VLAN tag spaces, they each need their own bridge. Also, this scheme allows the administrator to give the host IP addresses on the provider networks if needed via ports on the bridge, and L2 MAC learning applies to all traffic on the physical network bridges. 

3) We definitely will need to update all relevant documentation once this is merged. I plan to update the corresponding devstack patch to show how to use both tunnels and VLANs for tenant networks.

An updated patch set will be posted shortly with changes suggested by Gary and Salvatore, as well as a couple other minor improvements and cleanups.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Enhances provider extension to support flat networks and VLANs on
multiple physical networks for the openvswitch plugin. Implements
blueprint provider-networks.

Usage and configuration are similar to the linuxbridge
implementation. GRE tunnels are enabled and their id ranges are
configured via:

tunnel_id_ranges = <tun_min>:<tun_max>

A devstack patch to configure tunneling using the configuration
variables is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11418/. By default,
devstack configures openvswitch to use tunnels for tenant networks,
with no physical networks available for provider networks. To use
VLANs instead of tunnels, set OVS_ENABLE_TUNNELING=False in
localrc. The bridge used for tenant VLANs, which is also avaiable for
provider networks, can be specified with OVS_DEFAULT_BRIDGE=br-eth1 in
localrc.

'}, {'created': '2012-08-31 04:01:46.000000000', 'message': 'Implementation of 2nd phase of provider extension for openswitch

Enhances provider extension to support flat networks and VLANs on
multiple physical networks for the openvswitch plugin. Implements
blueprint provider-networks.

Usage and configuration are similar to the linuxbridge
implementation. GRE tunnels are enabled and their id ranges are
configured via:

tunnel_id_ranges = <tun_min>:<tun_max>

A devstack patch to configure tunneling using the configuration
variables is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11418/. By default,
devstack configures openvswitch to use tunnels for tenant networks,
with no physical networks available for provider networks. To use
VLANs instead of tunnels, set OVS_ENABLE_TUNNELING=False in
localrc. The bridge used for tenant VLANs, which is also avaiable for
provider networks, can be specified with OVS_DEFAULT_BRIDGE=br-eth1 in
localrc.

Change-Id: Ic86b6f3b2e354c7d60bc2c330b334c23d349bc29
'}]
commit_message:
Implementation of 2nd phase of provider extension for openswitch

Enhances openvswitch plugin to support flat networks and VLANs on
multiple physical networks via the provider extension. Implements
blueprint provider-networks.

See http://wiki.openstack.org/ConfigureOpenvswitch for
configuration and usage details.

A devstack patch to support the updated openvswitch configuration
variables is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11418/.

Change-Id: Ic86b6f3b2e354c7d60bc2c330b334c23d349bc29

commit_message:
Set glance authtoken in config, not paste

Glance can use the keystone_authtoken config section in
glance-api-conf and glance-registry.conf instead of having
to write into paste files.

Change-Id: Iaf372f3a01558b8305b5c5f5f64113a3674e9782

commit_message:
Make sure quota error message is displayed in overview page.

Fixes bug 1040799.

This commit fixes the bug that error message "Unable to retrieve quota
information" detected during rendering nova/overview page is displayed
after moving to the next page.

Hi,
A few comments:
1. The commit message is not good. It should be:

"Update rootwrap mechanism to track changes in nova/cinder

Fixes bug 1037815. ...."
2. The file quantum/tests/etc/quantum.conf.test should not be deleted
3. The list of agent root wrap files is incomplete (ryu, nec, l3 are missing). In addition to this the dhcp does not include ip and ovs commands. This and the l3 agent make use of the interface.py file.
4. Please update each ini file with the root wrap (as you did with the linux bridge). 
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2974, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Thanks for working on it.

The current rootwrap filter definitions are prepared per agent, but some definitions such as ovs/ryu/nec plugin agent have similar entries. It may be integrated into one file.

In addition, I am now checking which commands are called in each agent (including L3-agent). After checking is done, I will post a comment.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

I checked which commands are called in l3_agent and other plugin agent.
I wrote draft of filters for l3_agent and nec_quantum_agent

l3_agent.filters: http://paste.openstack.org/show/20428/
nec_plugin.filters: http://paste.openstack.org/show/20429/

(3 inline comments)

John,

The commit message still needs a bit of work. See http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritWorkflow#Committing_Changes. 

First, the first paragraph of the commit message is what is used for the title of the change by gerrit. It should be a single line (no period needed) followed by a blank line, and should be 50 characters or less. I would remove "quantum: " from the beginning of the line, so it just reads "Update rootwrap to track changes in nova and cinder" (followed by blank line)

Also, the bug reference just needs to be "bug <#>". Gerrit will make this into a link, and will associate the change with the bug report.'}, {'account_id': 2974, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

replies to jrd's replies. no major issues."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: (10 inline comments)

overall looks good.  a couple things to discuss: 

- it seems like the plan is to align filter files with the user facing binaries, not the source code.  this results in duplication across filters, which is a pain, but I guess makes the life of the packagers easier.  If that's the case, there's one instance (iptables) that needs to be cleaned up.  

- If we want to avoid this code falling into disrepair in the future, I think we need some way that unit tests or devstack gating will fail if someone adds a new command but doesn't update rootwrap.  One way to do that would be to have rootwrap be enabled by default.  Other possibilities may exist as well."}, {'account_id': 2974, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (13 inline comments)

>dan wendlandt		1:37 AM
>
>Patch Set 7: (10 inline comments)
>
>overall looks good. a couple things to discuss:
>
>    it seems like the plan is to align filter files with the user facing binaries, not the source code. this results in duplication across filters, which is a pain, but I guess makes the life of the packagers easier. If that's the case, there's one instance (iptables) that needs to be cleaned up.

On this one, I advocate leaving the structure as is, at least for
now.  Partly due to the reason you cite above, and partly due to my
goal of minimizing scope where possible.  I'm trying to limit the
scope of this fix to getting the mechanism up to snuff w/r/t the
similar facilities in nova/cinder, while not getting snared in
cleaning up stuff which is more far afield.

If you guys think it makes more sense to tackle those other cleanups
now, rather than deferring them, I can dive back in.

>    If we want to avoid this code falling into disrepair in the future, I think we need some way that unit tests or devstack gating will fail if someone adds a new command but doesn't update rootwrap. One way to do that would be to have rootwrap be enabled by default. Other possibilities may exist as well.

IIRC we discussed in previous threads the issue of enabling rootwrap
by default in the quantum agents.  I think that might make sense, but
I'm reluctant to do that right now, due to scope (as above) and lack
of testing.  I'd like to see the facility get fixed, to give the
people familiar with the individual agents the opportunity to ensure
that they can turn on rootwrap safely.  IOW, I don't want to be
responsible for checking in something which blows everybody out of the
water :-)

How 'bout adding a set of bugs saying "let's test the agent X rootwrap
filters, and enable rootwrap when they're working" ?

Thanks again for your careful review...'}, {'account_id': 2974, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

I'm still seeing errors from DHCP: 


2012-08-30 15:33:04  WARNING [quantum.agent.dhcp_agent] Unable to enable dhcp. Exception: 
Command: ['sudo', 'quantum-rootwrap', '/etc/quantum/rootwrap.conf', 'ovs-vsctl', '--', '--may-exist', 'add-port', 'br-int', 'tap445545ae-1b', '--', 'set', 'Interface', 'tap445545ae-1b', 'type=internal', '--', 'set', 'Interface', 'tap445545ae-1b', 'external-ids:iface-id=445545ae-1b6e-481e-ac92-3dde0bc0b24e', '--', 'set', 'Interface', 'tap445545ae-1b', 'external-ids:iface-status=active', '--', 'set', 'Interface', 'tap445545ae-1b', 'external-ids:attached-mac=fa:16:3e:1f:06:f9']
Exit code: 99
Stdout: 'Unauthorized command: /etc/quantum/rootwrap.conf ovs-vsctl -- --may-exist add-port br-int tap445545ae-1b -- set Interface tap445545ae-1b type=internal -- set Interface tap445545ae-1b external-ids:iface-id=445545ae-1b6e-481e-ac92-3dde0bc0b24e -- set Interface tap445545ae-1b external-ids:iface-status=active -- set Interface tap445545ae-1b external-ids:attached-mac=fa:16:3e:1f:06:f9\n'
Stderr: ''

The dhcp code creates interfaces just like the l3 code, so it would seem that the dhcp filter we need the same ovs-vsctl commands that the l3 filter has.   

Also, in both cases, those filters seem to be missing the brctl and ip commands needed if linux bridge vif-plugging was being used instead of OVS.  

What i'm confused about though is that I thought in a devstack setup like this, a command would be permitted if any of the filters allowed it, so I'm not sure any of my above comments explain the failure of the ovs-vsctl command."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

ugh... may be have been testing with an old branch... sorry.  let me retest.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Approving, thanks for the work on this.  Testing with an updated version worked with rootwrap enabled.  

I've filed three follow-up bugs: 
- devstack support: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1044084
- special handling for ip netns exec: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1044083
- strategy for automating the detection of missing filters: https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1044085

I'd also be curious to here your comments on what I mentioned in the last review comment regarding whether ovs-vsctl and brctl stuff needs to be called out in dhcp and l3 filters, if a single filter file is intended to work with each agent."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Also, we'll need to add support to devstack soon to copy the config files, setup agents to use rootwrap, not run the agents as root, etc.."}, {'account_id': 2974, 'date': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-30 23:18:11.000000000', 'message': "Update rootwrap; track changes in nova/cinder

Fix bug 1037815

Summary: Copy/paste the essential parts of the rootwrap
  mechanism from nova/cinder into quantum.  This includes
  the core changes to filter.py and wrapper.py which deal
  with loading filters from files pointed to by
  rootwrap.conf
Detailed changes:
  Transliterate the old rootwrap/*-agent.py files to
  new format, and put the results in etc/quantum/rootwrap.d
  Delete the *-agent.py files.
  Add conf to point to etc/quantum/rootwrap.d
  Add a unit test cribbed from nova to exercise the filter
  mechanism
  Add a unit test to exercise the actual filtered execution
Note that as written, this patch does not set the default
  execute mechanism (in the agent .ini files) to rootwrap,
  leaves it as sudo.  That can be done in a followon
  change, or in distro specific packaging.
Note also that there is still work to do around finishing
  and testing the filter specs themselves.  We've decided
  that that is out of scope for this patch.

Change-Id: I9aba6adc5ba40b6145be5fa38c5ece3b666ae5ca

commit_message:
Update rootwrap; track changes in nova/cinder

Fix bug 1037815

Summary: Copy/paste the essential parts of the rootwrap
  mechanism from nova/cinder into quantum.  This includes
  the core changes to filter.py and wrapper.py which deal
  with loading filters from files pointed to by
  rootwrap.conf
Detailed changes:
  Transliterate the old rootwrap/*-agent.py files to
  new format, and put the results in etc/quantum/rootwrap.d
  Delete the *-agent.py files.
  Add conf to point to etc/quantum/rootwrap.d
  Add a unit test cribbed from nova to exercise the filter
  mechanism
  Add a unit test to exercise the actual filtered execution
Note that as written, this patch does not set the default
  execute mechanism (in the agent .ini files) to rootwrap,
  leaves it as sudo.  That can be done in a followon
  change, or in distro specific packaging.
Note also that there is still work to do around finishing
  and testing the filter specs themselves.  We've decided
  that that is out of scope for this patch.

Change-Id: I9aba6adc5ba40b6145be5fa38c5ece3b666ae5ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-29 19:25:15.000000000', 'message': "Move authtoken config out of paste

Since we can now configure Keystone's auth_token middleware using
our own config files, we should ship our example config to show
how this is done. This moves the auth_* variables out of
glance-api-paste.ini and glance-registry-paste.ini into
glance-api.conf and glance-registry.conf.

Fixes bug 1043490

Change-Id: Ibdaf8b2ef0f55e5e892fbd1b994dceb323f07c7b
"}]
commit_message:
Move authtoken config out of paste

Since we can now configure Keystone's auth_token middleware using
our own config files, we should ship our example config to show
how this is done. This moves the auth_* variables out of
glance-api-paste.ini and glance-registry-paste.ini into
glance-api.conf and glance-registry.conf.

Fixes bug 1043490

Change-Id: Ibdaf8b2ef0f55e5e892fbd1b994dceb323f07c7b

commit_message:
External locking for image caching.

If the instance storage is shared between compute nodes, then you
need external locking which is also shared to avoid clobbering each
other's attempts to cache base images. Resolves bug 1014227.

Change-Id: Ic2ac87840904fa199c17774dae9556ad6c7a3eaf

I haven't finished reviewing this yet, but I figured I'd give you what feedback I have right now and then come back with more when I get the chance.

I'd rather have the <type> and <verb> in the metric names downcased; a metric name like "proxy-server.Object.GET.200.xfer" is harder to remember than "proxy-server.object.get.200.xfer". I could go either way on the verb, as those are often typed out in uppercase (and are uppercase on the wire in HTTP), but the type ought to be all lower case.

Also, one inline comment nitpicking the docs.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-08-29 17:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-20 04:16:53.000000000', 'message': 'Upating proxy-server StatsD logging.

Removed many StatsD logging calls in proxy-server and added
swift-informant-style catch-all logging in the proxy-logger middleware.
Many errors previously rolled into the "proxy-server.<type>.errors"
counter will now appear broken down by response code and with timing
data at: "proxy-server.<type>.<verb>.<status>.timing".  Also, bytes
transferred (sum of in + out) will be at:
"proxy-server.<type>.<verb>.<status>.xfer".

Updated the admin guide's StatsD docs to reflect the above change and
also include the "proxy-server.<type>.handoff_count" and
"proxy-server.<type>.handoff_all_count" metrics.

Removed some stale access_log_* related code in proxy/server.py.

Fixed up the sample config files a bit (logging lines, mostly).

Got proxy_logging.py test coverage to 100%.

Fixed proxy_logging.py for PEP8 v1.3.2.

Enhanced test.unit.FakeLogger to track more calls to enable testing
StatsD metric calls.

Change-Id: I45d94cb76450be96d66fcfab56359bdfdc3a2576
'}, {'created': '2012-08-21 19:05:13.000000000', 'message': 'Upating proxy-server StatsD logging.

Removed many StatsD logging calls in proxy-server and added
swift-informant-style catch-all logging in the proxy-logger middleware.
Many errors previously rolled into the "proxy-server.<type>.errors"
counter will now appear broken down by response code and with timing
data at: "proxy-server.<type>.<verb>.<status>.timing".  Also, bytes
transferred (sum of in + out) will be at:
"proxy-server.<type>.<verb>.<status>.xfer".

Updated the admin guide's StatsD docs to reflect the above change and
also include the "proxy-server.<type>.handoff_count" and
"proxy-server.<type>.handoff_all_count" metrics.

The proxy server now saves off the original req.method and proxy_logging
will use this if it can (both for request logging and as the "<verb>" in
the statsd timing metric).  This fixes bug 1025433.

Removed some stale access_log_* related code in proxy/server.py.  Also
removed the BaseApplication/Application distinction as it's no longer
necessary.

Fixed up the sample config files a bit (logging lines, mostly).

Got proxy_logging.py test coverage to 100%.

Fixed proxy_logging.py for PEP8 v1.3.2.

Enhanced test.unit.FakeLogger to track more calls to enable testing
StatsD metric calls.

Change-Id: I45d94cb76450be96d66fcfab56359bdfdc3a2576

middleware can get its StatsD config from standard vars in [DEFAULT] or

Similarly to Swift Informant, request methods ("verbs") are filtered
using the new proxy-logging config var, "log_statsd_valid_http_methods"
which defaults to GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, and COPY.  Requests with
methods not in this list use "BAD_METHOD" for <verb> in the metric name.
To avoid user error, access_log_statsd_valid_http_methods is also
accepted.

"Object" for the <type>, but these are now all lowercase.

also include the "proxy-server.<type>.handoff_count" and

commit_message:
Upating proxy-server StatsD logging.

Removed many StatsD logging calls in proxy-server and added
swift-informant-style catch-all logging in the proxy-logger middleware.
Many errors previously rolled into the "proxy-server.<type>.errors"
counter will now appear broken down by response code and with timing
data at: "proxy-server.<type>.<verb>.<status>.timing".  Also, bytes
transferred (sum of in + out) will be at:
"proxy-server.<type>.<verb>.<status>.xfer".  The proxy-logging
middleware can get its StatsD config from standard vars in [DEFAULT] or
from access_log_statsd_* config vars in its config section.

Similarly to Swift Informant, request methods ("verbs") are filtered
using the new proxy-logging config var, "log_statsd_valid_http_methods"
which defaults to GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, and COPY.  Requests with
methods not in this list use "BAD_METHOD" for <verb> in the metric name.
To avoid user error, access_log_statsd_valid_http_methods is also
accepted.

Previously, proxy-server metrics used "Account", "Container", and
"Object" for the <type>, but these are now all lowercase.

Updated the admin guide's StatsD docs to reflect the above changes and
also include the "proxy-server.<type>.handoff_count" and
"proxy-server.<type>.handoff_all_count" metrics.

The proxy server now saves off the original req.method and proxy_logging
will use this if it can (both for request logging and as the "<verb>" in
the statsd timing metric).  This fixes bug 1025433.

Removed some stale access_log_* related code in proxy/server.py.  Also
removed the BaseApplication/Application distinction as it's no longer
necessary.

Fixed up the sample config files a bit (logging lines, mostly).

Fixed typo in SAIO development guide.

Got proxy_logging.py test coverage to 100%.

Fixed proxy_logging.py for PEP8 v1.3.2.

Enhanced test.unit.FakeLogger to track more calls to enable testing
StatsD metric calls.

Change-Id: I45d94cb76450be96d66fcfab56359bdfdc3a2576

commit_message:
Add 'detaching' to volume status

Fixes bug #1004382

When attach a volume , the volume status is "available -> attaching ->
in-use", But when detaching a volume , the volume status is "in-use ->
available". So We need 'detaching' volume status, it make the change of
state of the volume more clearly.

Change-Id: Idf8c38413135bf8e8cd025f11937f8c7250557c1

commit_message:
Splits out build config params in Tempest.

The build parameters for instances and volumes should be configured separately.

This patch adds the following Tempest vars:
COMPUTE_BUILD_INTERVAL
COMPUTE_BUILD_TIMEOUT
VOLUME_BUILD_INTERVAL
VOLUME_BUILD_TIMEOUT

Change-Id: Ia5357114f8e4248a8de4bd0327e08323c487e897

[{'created': '2012-08-23 18:44:12.000000000', 'message': "Prevent stale isolated tenants from blocking test runs

Especially while developing tests, it's easy to kill a test before
it has a chance to clean up the tenants it has created for isolation.
Since the database has a lot of consistency requirements, it's non-
trivial to go clean these up, and (for me) re-running stack.sh is
the quickest path to a running system again (which is annoying).

This patch adds a configuration option that can allow the tenant
creation to avoid the failure by re-using the existing tenant/user
already present. I think it's safe to have this enabled by default
since it only happens if tenant isolation is enabled.

commit_message:
Prevent stale isolated tenants from blocking test runs

Especially while developing tests, it's easy to kill a test before
it has a chance to clean up the tenants it has created for isolation.
Since the database has a lot of consistency requirements, it's non-
trivial to go clean these up, and (for me) re-running stack.sh is
the quickest path to a running system again (which is annoying).

This patch adds a configuration option that can allow the tenant
creation to avoid the failure by re-using the existing tenant/user
already present. I think it's safe to have this enabled by default
since it only happens if tenant isolation is enabled.

Also, this augments the error message for the condition (in the case
that the configuration option is disabled) to better indicate
what is happening.

Change-Id: I97052b827ca1b2076ac67025539339b39d3260ae

commit_message:
Assume virt disk size is consumed by instances.

Use disk_available_least other than free_disk_gb to consume.
assume virt disk size is consumed by instances when calculate
the available disk size.
fix bug lp:1042071

Change-Id: I82dc3bcfd97219085c624c81dfa47cbf0bcd4504

commit_message:
Remove unused exceptions from cinder/exception.py

find cinder/ -type f -name "*pyc" -exec rm {} \;
exceptions=`cat cinder/exception.py| grep -E '^class' |\
 awk {'print $2'} | awk -F '(' {'print $1'}`
for exc in $exceptions
do
    i=`find cinder/ -type f -exec grep -R $exc {} \; |wc -l`
    if [ $i -eq 1 ]
    then
        echo $exc
    fi
done

First removed exceptions:

DecryptionFailure
ImagePaginationFailed
VirtualInterfaceCreateException
VirtualInterfaceMacAddressException
MelangeConnectionFailed

commit_message:
Remove deprecated auth from docs

fixes bug 1034143

This patch removes various sections and updates some wording to
remove deprecated auth from the documentation and state that
OpenStack Identity is the choice now.

Patch Set 2 fixes minor sentence problem in
doc/src/docbkx/openstack-compute-admin/computeconfigure.xml.

Change-Id: I5c109666812b6a96514887bef1fedcfa68abf1ff

subject: Change '_' to '-' in options
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-merge/75/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-docs/44/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-pep8/74/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-python26/73/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-python27/74/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-08-23 19:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 19:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-merge/77/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-docs/46/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-pep8/76/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-python26/75/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-cinderclient-python27/76/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-08-23 19:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-08-29 19:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Wow, so um... that looks like it was a bunch of work, thanks doing this!

I guess I'm lazy but I would rather see the translation handled dynamically, e.g.

https://github.com/clayg/python-cinderclient/compare/dash-args

The benefit here is that we can leave in support for _ args as long as needed without any extra burden or cruft (except in our ArgumentParser subclasss).  We can update the decorators at our leisure, but it's no big deal.  But, *most* of all users don't have to know/care which opts are "legacy compatible" and which are new (and wouldn't support underscores without the double def).  All args support both for free!

Plus there's the muscle memory argument... it could take me a year to get used to typing the dashes.  Meanwhile I'm cursing being forced to type dashes on SOME opts.  And even after that some hackers may like having the the python/json var display_name mentally map directly to the command line arg --display_name (I sorta assumed that's why the convention was adopted in the first place).

Any interest in trying this approach with this branch, or I could possibly try to pull in your changes to my example/hack and put up for review?

It's just an idea, if someone else wants to come along and merge this - I'm not going to cry a river.  Something like I'm describing could even be added later in a modified form if some of my concerns turn out to actually be a problem (they may not).

Best Regards,

-clayg'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-08-30 14:48:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

* The support of the underscore form of options is transitional at best.  It may be around for a year or more but it is not permanent.
* Not supporting underscore forms for new options is part of encouraging the switch to dashes.  We don't break existing scripts but we do begin to re-train fingers.  Most of the users will learn to just use dashes in all long options.

This is the last CLI binary to be patched in this manner.  I'm looking to provide a _consistent_ user experience."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-08-30 15:13:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Approved

I'd prefer consistency and even if it's easy I don't see any point in preserving both.

Also, I want to follow the other projects which are moving this way."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-30 15:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-30 15:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/11851/2/gate/gate-python-cinderclient-merge/91 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11851/2/gate/gate-python-cinderclient-docs/60 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11851/2/gate/gate-python-cinderclient-pep8/90 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11851/2/gate/gate-python-cinderclient-python26/89 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/11851/2/gate/gate-python-cinderclient-python27/90 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-30 15:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Change '_' to '-' in options

This changes every command-line option with a '_' in its name
and changes them to '-'.  The old option names are maintained
for backward compatibility but are no longer in the help text.

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I439fc9742762e626610a7b0774ed1274cf38ceb7

commit_message:
added mongodb auth

Implements bug 1022679.  mongodb needs auth=true to be turned on, and user
accounts in the appropriate dbs would need to be created.  Add to ceilometer
conf:

'database_connection=mongodb://username:password@<hostname>:<port#>/<dbname>'

Change-Id: I6fbe563cb5660e2374edfe39b325a68c56ccd39a

commit_message:
Add a new exception for live migration.

Raises new exception InvalidLocalStorage instead of
InvalidSharedStorage when block migration is used with shared storage.
Corrects the message of InvalidSharedStorage.

Fixes bug 1043165

Change-Id: I68bfac3f89276edc38c00ca963911fe07456dc0d

commit_message:
remove policy check for host_routes in update_port

Fixes bug 1043630

Port has no 'host_routes' attribute according to the latest V2 API
specification. So, policy check for 'host_routes' is not need any
more, just remove it in this patch.

Change-Id: I925e83d9825f89265843c15e71ee5ed4c33bad5f

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-18 05:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

It's unclear to me how user-visible this is from the comment in the bug:

  This is happening when the gateway initialization code is called a second time

Under what conditions is this code "called a second time". When you restart nova-network?

Presuming this is actually a user-visible bug in essex, it looks serious. The fix is isolated to quantum manager code, looks plausible and has been on master for a month.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-18 06:10:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh, I forgot to say - the devstack failure is in the volumes code and presumably isn't with quantum enabled, so it must be some sort of transient issue. Hopefully won't see it when the patch is approved."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-06-18 06:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The way the QuantumManager code was behaving, the plug operation was being called on the gateway device at least two times (even without restarting the server). This apparently started happening after some changes were made to the QuantumManager code to support the HA option (multiple nova-network nodes running QuantumManager). It was felt that the easiest way to fix this issue (given that QuantumManager itself is stop-gap) was to provide this check.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-18 07:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"This apparently started happening after ..."

Is the issue visible to users of the stable/essex branch? If not, we shouldn't backport the fix'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-21 16:03:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Need an answer whether this bug is actually visible on essex"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-26 11:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sumits comments from the bug:

The patch which which seems to have introduced this issue is:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/983024, and that has been tagged as
an essex-backport. If that code does get backported, we will see this
issue in Essex.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-04 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-30 10:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

bug #1042249 suggests this is an issue with 2012.1.2

Care to re-open Gary?'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-17 13:58:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix for Quantum LinuxBridge Intf driver plug call

The current implementation of the plug operation tries to assign an IP
address to a bridge even if it already has one. The fix is to do this
only when a new device is created. The check for a new device was
already being performed however the IP address was being set outside
that check. That's being corrected here, minor fix.

bug 1000580

Change-Id: I45215a3ca87a32ef4c2a2f76bab9b743eabb525e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for Quantum LinuxBridge Intf driver plug call

The current implementation of the plug operation tries to assign an IP
address to a bridge even if it already has one. The fix is to do this
only when a new device is created. The check for a new device was
already being performed however the IP address was being set outside
that check. That's being corrected here, minor fix.

bug 1000580

Change-Id: I45215a3ca87a32ef4c2a2f76bab9b743eabb525e

commit_message:
Ensure network connectivity for linuxbridge flat network.

Fixes bug 1040447

In the event that an IP address and gateway are defined on an interface that is
used in a flat network, then the interface details will be copied to the
bridge when it is created.
If the network is deleted then the IP addresses are returned to the interface.

Change-Id: Ic860d7635c137f49e5aaaa25dc9727ac60227f1a

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-07-20 18:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-07-25 15:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think this patch useful, becouse there are many hard coded constants in Swift. With this patch chance to use wrong constants like network chunk or disk chunk will be reduced. Also, I belive that Swift's associated projects may use constants from swift.common.constants, then if will be needed to change some constants it can be done just in Swift core code."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-09 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-09 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-08-22 12:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-22 19:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

[Apologies if multiple paragraphs don't format properly...]

1024 appears twice in swift/proxy/server.py as a constant determining how many bytes of a response body get included an error message.  It could use a semantic constant analogous to MAX_OBJECT_NAME_LENGTH which is now used in the object server.

It looks like swift/common/db.py still has "MB = (1024 * 1024)" which should be the new MIB constant.

The default max_bytes_per_second in swift/obj/auditor.py could be represented as "10 * MB" instead of 10000000.

In swift/common/middleware/formpost.py, max_file_size could be represented as "100 * MIB" instead of 104857600.  Also, a "600" in the same file could be "10 * MINUTE".  Also, a "timeout=60" could be "timeout=MINUTE".

swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py has two "60"s which could be "MINUTE".

swift/common/ring/builder.py has a "3600" which could be "HOUR".

get_time_units() in swift/common/utils.py has several "60"s which could be "MINUTE".

swift/common/wsgi.py has a "600" and "60" which could be "10 * MINUTE" and "MINUTE", respectively.

"/etc/swift" appears in a path (to swift.conf) in swift/common/utils.py which could be "os.path.join(DEFAULT_SWIFT_DIR, 'swift.conf')".

swift/obj/expirer.py appears to have a fall-back path which includes "/etc/swift" which should be "os.path.join(DEFAULT_SWIFT_DIR, 'object-expired.conf')"

swift/common/middleware/recon.py and swift/container/server.py contain the strings "/srv/node/" which could be "os.path.join(DEFAULT_DEVICES, '')"

swift/common/middleware/recon.py should use DEFAULT_RECON_CACHE.

swift/common/middleware/recon.py should use *_RING_FILE constants.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
swift.common.constants for swift widly used constants

Create a module for swift widly used constants like swift_dir and other.

* Add more comments to swift.common.constants
* Add synonyms for KB (KIB), MB (MIB), GB (GIB)
* Move swift.common.utils.TRUE_VALUES to swift.common.constants.TRUE_VALUES

Change-Id: I45db39fc8701457c76c934a64f5ab73c1fd7d975

commit_message:
Implements PowerVM get_available_resource method.

Implements get_available_resource method in the PowerVM driver to
fix the failure when launching nova-compute. Also, it removes the
update_available_resource method from PowerVMDriver which is no longer
required.

Fixes bug 1040789

Change-Id: Ibc7e9b80e6d9b8ef3c1a844783a890c592517f89

commit_message:
hacking: Add driver prefix recommendation.

Prefixing the commit message's first line with the driver makes it
easier for reviewers, at a glance, to find reviews that relate to their
area of expertise as well as improving the overall readability of the
git history.

Change-Id: I376d2cdb5dc344717fb7749a80e33ee88603e68c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-28 14:17:18.000000000', 'message': 'Sort API extensions when using the standard loader

Updates the load_standard_extensions function so that it keeps track
of each classpath in a list and then sorts them before loading
the extensions.

We need to do this because os.walk returns things in a platform specific
order and consistent ordering is very important for testing.

This fixes the
integrated.test_api_samples.ServersSampleAllExtensionXmlTest.test_servers_get
test which fails on Fedora 17 (but passes on Fedora 16 and apparently
some other distros as well).

Fixes LP Bug #1042709.

Change-Id: I82c679f457a3cd11c8a8cd76f402693b61bb14cc
'}, {'created': '2012-08-29 18:43:47.000000000', 'message': 'Sort API extensions by alias.

Updates the ExtensionManager so that extensions are sorted by alias when
accessed via the get_resources or get_controller_extensions functions.

This fixes the
integrated.test_api_samples.ServersSampleAllExtensionXmlTest.test_servers_get
test which fails on Fedora 17 (but passes on Fedora 16 and apparently
some other distros as well).

Includes updated api_samples for XML that was regenerated by the
test_servers_get test.

Fixes LP Bug #1042709.

Change-Id: I82c679f457a3cd11c8a8cd76f402693b61bb14cc
'}, {'created': '2012-08-29 20:02:12.000000000', 'message': 'Sort API extensions by alias.

Updates the ExtensionManager so that extensions are sorted by alias when
accessed via the get_resources or get_controller_extensions functions.

This fixes the
integrated.test_api_samples.ServersSampleAllExtensionXmlTest.test_servers_get
test which fails on Fedora 17 (but passes on Fedora 16 and apparently
some other distros as well).

Includes updated api_samples for XML that was regenerated by the
test_servers_get test.

Fixes LP Bug #1042709.

Change-Id: I82c679f457a3cd11c8a8cd76f402693b61bb14cc
'}]
commit_message:
Sort API extensions by alias.

Updates the ExtensionManager so that extensions are sorted by alias when
accessed via the get_resources or get_controller_extensions functions.

This fixes the
integrated.test_api_samples.ServersSampleAllExtensionXmlTest.test_servers_get
test which fails on Fedora 17 (but passes on Fedora 16 and apparently
some other distros as well).

Includes updated api_samples for XML that was regenerated by the
test_servers_get test.

Fixes LP Bug #1042709.

Change-Id: I82c679f457a3cd11c8a8cd76f402693b61bb14cc

commit_message:
Make flavorextradata ignore deleted flavors.

In _get_flavor_refs, don't retrieve inactive flavors. Fixes bug 1026210.

This change was made on trunk in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9995/

Change-Id: I967faa661cd4177a54079a966ca8912923c5f61b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-27 22:44:22.000000000', 'message': "Raise Fobidden exception in image_get

The simple db driver now raises 'exception.Forbidden' when a caller
tries to access an image that is not owned by the provided context.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

Change-Id: Idb2b85252d5ad33194d3bd8b5d8a9bc368968bd0
"}, {'created': '2012-08-28 01:03:52.000000000', 'message': "Raise Fobidden exception in image_get

The simple db driver now raises 'exception.Forbidden' when a caller
tries to access an image that is not owned by the provided context.
The list of images returned by image_get_all will also be filtered
to match what the sqlalchemy driver is expected to return.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

Change-Id: Idb2b85252d5ad33194d3bd8b5d8a9bc368968bd0
"}, {'created': '2012-08-28 18:03:22.000000000', 'message': "Raise Forbidden exception in image_get

The simple db driver now raises 'exception.Forbidden' when a caller
tries to access an image that is not owned by the provided context.
The list of images returned by image_get_all will also be filtered
to match what the sqlalchemy driver is expected to return.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

Change-Id: Idb2b85252d5ad33194d3bd8b5d8a9bc368968bd0
"}]
commit_message:
Raise Forbidden exception in image_get

The simple db driver now raises 'exception.Forbidden' when a caller
tries to access an image that is not owned by the provided context.
The list of images returned by image_get_all will also be filtered
to match what the sqlalchemy driver is expected to return.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity.

Change-Id: Idb2b85252d5ad33194d3bd8b5d8a9bc368968bd0

commit_message:
Change timestamp management for resources

When saving an event, update the timestamp on a resource to the
event timestamp instead of the current timestamp on the
collector host.

Change-Id: Ice378cb5be0820d8b817b7c4f635b8a5a8eef3b5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Add new arguments to run_tests

Execute unit tests and pep8 by default. Allow tests to be chosen in a more
additive fashion. Cleaned up unnecessary let statements and variable
defines.

Change-Id: I40676c5d0deda7bd3abc4bdadfd404f5909c166e
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cisco nexus sub-plugin update_network fix

Fixes bug 1043147

Currently, the cisco nexus sub-plugin doesn’t handle the network admin state parameter
when it’s updated. The fix would enable the sub-plugin to handle an update of the admin
state of the network. In update_network of the nexus sub-plugin, vlan corresponding to that network
is added/removed from the nexus interfaces based on the network state. Unit tests are added as well.

Change-Id: Ia3b5400c2896c1b0160968a2c75c21247ca0c3f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-28 03:03:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove the gettext wrapper of server_type.

The gettext wrapper of server_type in controllers is used to translate
server_type in log. But the transfer_headers function which used to
filter the illegal metadata headers use the wrapped server_type. So, it
will cause problems that 'X-Account-Meta-' and 'X-Container-Meta-' would
be filtered when the language of operating system is not english, such
as Chinese or Japnese. So, I removed the wrapper.

Change-Id: I7d47e67b4caf5d0be171a90740f9bb12fa2cba84
Fixes: Bug #1042142
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the gettext wrapper of server_type.

The gettext wrapper of server_type in controllers is used to translate
server_type in log. But the transfer_headers function which used to
filter the illegal metadata headers use the wrapped server_type. So, it
will cause problems that 'X-Account-Meta-' and 'X-Container-Meta-' would
be filtered when the language of operating system is not english, such
as Chinese or Japnese. So, I removed the wrapper.

Change-Id: I7d47e67b4caf5d0be171a90740f9bb12fa2cba84
Fixes: Bug #1042142

"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-08-14 08:21:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Jay,

The issue with the test naming was my bad copy'n'paste, apologies!

Just on the approach taken in the patch, I found myself wondering if it wouldn't be better to entirely move the image validation logic out of the DB API layer, and instead do it eagerly in the image API layer.

The advantage would be that the incomplete/incorrect image creation would be rejected at the earliest opportunity and we'd avoid polluting the registry API with concerns about the presence or absence of image data.

Is the argument against such an approach that the registry API is likely to be used stand-alone also?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-22 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-22 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-13 01:47:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fail early if image metadata is invalid

Image data would be read and copied into a backed store
only to have invalid image metadata such as a missing
container format mark the image as killed and return a
400 to the caller. This was very inefficient of course.

There were tests written that would have caught this
problem, but unfortunately the tests were incorrectly named
with a _do_test_xxx prefix instead of the test_xxx prefix that
nose/unittest picks up. Correcting the test names showed multiple
failures and the corresponding fix was to send into the DB API
in the image metadata a "_data_inbound" flag that is used to
trigger a failure from the validate_image() function early to
avoid reading the image data unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I40e3dba6e0b511de446c048a35389e558a725573
Fixes: LP #1035982
'}, {'created': '2012-08-13 19:03:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fail early if image metadata is invalid

trigger a failure from the validate_image() function early to

Change-Id: I40e3dba6e0b511de446c048a35389e558a725573
Fixes: LP #1035982
'}, {'created': '2012-08-13 20:26:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fail early if image metadata is invalid

with a _do_test_xxx prefix instead of the test_xxx prefix that
nose/unittest picks up. Correcting the test names showed multiple
failures and the corresponding fix was to send into the DB API
in the image metadata a data_inbound flag that is used to
trigger a failure from the validate_image() function early to

Change-Id: I40e3dba6e0b511de446c048a35389e558a725573
Fixes: LP #1035982
'}]
commit_message:
Fail early if image metadata is invalid

Image data would be read and copied into a backed store
only to have invalid image metadata such as a missing
container format mark the image as killed and return a
400 to the caller. This was very inefficient of course.

There were tests written that would have caught this
problem, but unfortunately the tests were incorrectly named
with a _do_test_xxx prefix instead of the test_xxx prefix that
nose/unittest picks up. Correcting the test names showed multiple
failures and the corresponding fix was to send into the DB API
in the image metadata a data_inbound flag that is used to
trigger a failure from the validate_image() function early to
avoid reading the image data unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I40e3dba6e0b511de446c048a35389e558a725573
Fixes: LP #1035982

commit_message:
Add a new exception for live migration.

Raises new exception InvalidLocalStorage instead of
InvalidSharedStorage when block migration is used with shared storage.
Corrects the message of InvalidSharedStorage.

Fixes bug 1043165

Change-Id: I05cbf7f9508430ebfcd3dbfa0e1e5d91a806a26e

commit_message:
Do not run pylint by default

pylint creates some files, and leaves git in a detached HEAD.

pylint can still be run via 'tox -epylint'

Change-Id: Ic0193f2488f1c6eb4a9f0fabbe24ac9869239890

commit_message:
Ensure hairpin_mode is set whenever vifs is added to bridge.

Fix the bug that when create a snapshot of an instance, the
instance cann't ping it's floating ip.
fix bug lp:1040537

Change-Id: I607f45c6850f45f954682f8fbe68e3a89643ac0a

commit_message:
Do not crash when deleting image or volume with no name

This was crashing because we were trying to use None as a string to
display "Deleted: $name". Instead, we can use the id of the image in
this case.

Fixes bug 1031291.

Change-Id: I2fca0bac9f963bba89e7c0da613ebc79ead15aba

directory is set to root of NFS previously in step3.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-21 12:42:09.000000000', 'message': "fixes for nova-manage not returning a full list of fixed IPs

This fix correct the problem reported in bug 930193
nova-manage does not return a full list of fixed IPs. The reason
is that the call to fixed_ip['instance_id'] can throw exception
when fixed_ip does not have instance_id as its member. The changes
in this fix corrects the problem.
rebase to resolve the automatic merge issue.

Change-Id: Ic15a0a0f43f53b82f9d88a03803c96b44a8ddcb9
"}]
commit_message:
fixes for nova-manage not returning a full list of fixed IPs

This fix correct the problem reported in bug 930193
nova-manage does not return a full list of fixed IPs. The reason
is that the call to fixed_ip['instance_id'] can throw exception
when fixed_ip does not have instance_id as its member. The changes
in this fix corrects the problem.
rebase to resolve the automatic merge issue.

Change-Id: Ic15a0a0f43f53b82f9d88a03803c96b44a8ddcb9

commit_message:
Check if we have enough disk for the instance.

Check if we have enough disk to create all the instance disk files
that the instance has requested. This should also be a check in the
scheduler, but I'll do that one later.

Change-Id: Ib3fb3ebfde76beeb5ecca222110b96ab8db75657

Can you add the new config values to the proxy-server.conf-sample (in the static log section) and in the docstring at the top of the staticweb module? It looks like the previous patch should have added the sample config values and didn't. There's no need for this patch to cover all the places in the configs and docs where this should have been added, but this patch should at least add it to the sections that staticweb covers."}, {'account_id': 2332, 'date': '2012-07-31 13:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-31 14:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

I'd still like to see the sample config values in the docstring at the top of staticweb.

Also, the convention for swift config samples is to add the commented out option with value set to its default. Since udp logging is disabled, your sample config entries don't match. See the docstring in swift/common/utils.py:get_logger() for how this should look."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-20 04:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

FYI, I independently noticed the UDP logging settings missing from the sample config files.  I added them like this:
...
# You can specify default log routing here if you want:
# log_name = swift
# log_facility = LOG_LOCAL0
# log_level = INFO
# log_headers = False
# log_address = /dev/log
# If set, log_udp_host will override log_address
# log_udp_host =
# log_udp_port = 514
...

Does that match what you wanted, John?'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-20 04:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add UDP logging to staticweb

Implements UDP logging in static web, addition to UDP logging patch.
Added UDP options to the config file examples and docstring

UDP logging for staticweb was not included in commit f0eb25a973585e6a6cdb7c69a342fc6a38055e0d (add UDP support for logger).
This patch adds support to staticweb for logging to UDP.

Change-Id: Ibfea2cd10ca04070c92c1155d7465a2817074e50

I am not comfortable confirming this until it has some feedback from people that understand what it is doing, other than the original author."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-08-17 16:38:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think we need to have a discussion about what tools we should be carrying with the projects. This same issue applies to glance as well.

I personally don't think this is a great candidiate for shipping with the OpenStack projects as I assume it applies to a very small minority of deployers."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2012-08-17 16:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

OCF RA for Keystone is working very well in my infrastructure.'}, {'account_id': 2585, 'date': '2012-08-21 18:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Perfectly working in my environnement :)'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-08-21 20:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

I was originally fine with this idea, but after talking a bit more with other folks, I think including it in this repo isn't going to be good long term.

The basic gist of this thinking - while I've *used* OCF scripts, none of the core reviewers feel comfortable asserting that we can support and provide fixes for the OCF scripts, and none of us are entirely sure how to verify them short of doing an entire pacemaker setup to gain some empirical evidence.

We all agreed they were useful and valuable, and that this should exist and be available for the community at large to take advantage of - the thinking that this repo (i.e. formally a part of Keystone, even in a "contrib" like directory) just isn't the correct spot. 

This highlights the need for a community site to link to related projects, components, and tools like these that we (OpenStack wide) simply don't yet have.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-29 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-29 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add an OCF resource agent to Keystone.

Implements blueprint ocf-support.

This change set adds the newly written OCF resource agent to Keystone
in order to make it possible to run Keystone as a resource managed by
the Pacemaker cluster manager. Further details about this agent (and
the ones for Glance, too) can be found in this extensive blog post I
wrote when initially putting them up for testing:

http://www.hastexo.com/blogs/martin/2012/04/03/bringing-high-availability-openstack-keystone-and-glance

Change-Id: I753a657e5cd4ad5701f23c7dd61a35641d4b96b2

[{'created': '2012-08-12 18:15:06.000000000', 'message': "Added support for volume types

As cinder already supports volume types, it's time
to be added in Horizon. The types are added in syspanel.
A volume can either have a *valid* type, or None.

There are two minor issues:
1. When a type is deleted, if there is a volume with
   this type, the type is returned as the id,
   instead of the name. Which is good as consistency,
   but maybe a type should not be deleted if used by a volume?
2. If no vol type is passed(None) value, the type is being
   assigned as 'None', and returned as a string('None')
3. In the create volume type form, the 'Description' is
   empty at the moment, I couldn't find any help info
   to add for volume types...

Some more unit tests will be added, but this is just a preview.

Fixes bug 1022418

Change-Id: Ie105f0ac9544effff9d6f0b280d30f5c03fd69f3
"}, {'created': '2012-08-12 18:16:59.000000000', 'message': "Added support for volume types

commit_message:
Added support for volume types

As cinder already supports volume types, it's time
to be added in Horizon. The types are added in syspanel.
A volume can either have a *valid* type, or None.

There are two minor issues:
1. When a type is deleted, if there is a volume with
   this type, the type is returned as the id,
   instead of the name. Which is good as consistency,
   but maybe a type should not be deleted if used by a volume?
2. If no vol type is passed(None) value, the type is being
   assigned as 'None', and returned as a string('None')
3. In the create volume type form, the 'Description' is
   empty at the moment, I couldn't find any help info
   to add for volume types...

Fixes bug 1022418

Change-Id: Ie105f0ac9544effff9d6f0b280d30f5c03fd69f3

Removes the swift_auth _reseller_check function. This function
prohibits a valid swift use case which allows users to access
URLs from another tenant to which user level ACL or public

'}]
commit_message:
Remove swift_auth _reseller_check function.

Removes the swift_auth _reseller_check function. This function
prohibits a valid swift use case which allows users to access
URLs from another tenant to which user level ACL or public
access has been granted.

Fixes LP Bug #1020722.

Change-Id: I49c3e149ece2b25d102167dfd4c5e6ab15274368

commit_message:
Add option to configure Glance via service catalog

Adds a boolean 'glance_service_catalog' option which if set to True
will enable Nova to parse the service catalog for the Glance image
URL.

This solution is fully backwards compatible with the previous Glance
configuration options which store Glance API configs in the Nova
config file.

Also, adds glance_service_type, glance_endpoint_region, and
glance_endpoint_type options to configure which endpoint is
selected from the service catalog for Glance. These settings
only apply if glance_service_catalog is also enabled.

Change-Id: I6721938f131c866bc0f866d838805f924e951389

subject: fix bug where network owned resources block delete
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/11996/2/check/gate-quantum-merge/1470 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi,
I have been over the patch. I must be honest I do not think that the fact that the service thread has to sleep to wait for the agent to clean its resources is a good solution.
When the service performs an operation a notification is sent. At the moment the network deletion was prevented due to the fact that a port (for example dhcp) was defined on the network. Why not do the following:
1. Deleted network:-
    i. if there are port defined that are not dhcp or agent ports then return an exception that there are port in use
    ii. if there are only dhcp/l3 agent ports then delete these ports - the deletion should send a notification and cleanup the relevant allocations of the ports - for example ip allocations
    iii. the agent when it receives the notifications it will cleanup.
In the case of the l3 agent it polls the service. The dhcp agent works on notifications. Each should be able to treat the changes accordingly
Am I missing something?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Non-actionable suggestions inline.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

[{'created': '2012-08-29 05:55:20.000000000', 'message': 'add cooperative wait for deletion of net & subnets

bug 1028174

This patch fixes the bug by making Quantum retry until the max wait is
reached for an agent to clean-up the blocking resource.  When the wait is
reached, Quantum will force clean-up the the blockers that would
orginarily keep the network in use.  If there are other tenant owned resources
blocking the delete request, the proper InUse exception is raised.

Change-Id: I822cc4a92cb05cdef88679bb628fad4e5063cddd

commit_message:
fix bug where network owned resources block delete

bug 1028174

This patch fixes a bug in delete_network and delete_subnet where the InUse
exception was being thrown for resources owned by the network and not
the tenant.  This patch force deletes network resources if they are the
only blocker to deleting the parent resource.

Change-Id: I822cc4a92cb05cdef88679bb628fad4e5063cddd

[{'created': '2012-08-25 23:03:52.000000000', 'message': "Misc. swift-bench improvements.

swift-bench now honors the environment variables, ST_AUTH, ST_USER, and
ST_KEY like python-swiftclient does.

Added --lower-object-size (or -l) command-line option which, if
specified, will turn a specified --object-size into --upper-object-size.
It will raise a ValueError if --object-size is not specified or is <=
--lower-object-size.

BenchController how handles SIGINT (KeyboardInterrupt) similarly to the
swift command-line client: the first Ctrl-C will make it fast-track to
completion (no new PUT or GET operations are started, but everything PUT
is DELETE'ed).  A second Ctrl-C will immediately exit.  The behavior for
SIGTERM is unchanged (a single SIGTERM will immediately terminate the
process).

Change-Id: I6f394ad995300fc8af3d565d95c3b45559ee510a

commit_message:
Misc. swift-bench improvements.

swift-bench now honors the environment variables, ST_AUTH, ST_USER, and
ST_KEY like python-swiftclient does.

Added --lower-object-size (or -l) command-line option which, if
specified, will turn a specified --object-size into --upper-object-size.
It will raise a ValueError if --object-size is not specified or is <=
--lower-object-size.

BenchController how handles SIGINT (KeyboardInterrupt) similarly to the
swift command-line client: the first Ctrl-C will make it fast-track to
completion (no new PUT or GET operations are started, but everything PUT
is DELETE'ed).  A second Ctrl-C will immediately exit.  The behavior for
SIGTERM is unchanged (a single SIGTERM will immediately terminate the
process).

Added a sample configuration file for swift-bench, with documenting
comments.

Change-Id: I6f394ad995300fc8af3d565d95c3b45559ee510a
